text: This place is beyond amazing.  The food is soooooo good.  The service was amazing.  Our waitress was really good and attentive. It was just a great dinning experience.  We love the craft beers here and the view is a topper. We order the Attic wings and the Ivan burger, they were killer.  When in Arcadia must make a stop here.  They caterer to the late crowds on the weekends.  Wednesday are 10$ for a beer and burger deal.  They ask you don't split it, which is fine because it's a deal.  We can't wait to go back.  It really is a hidden spot.

Great food, great beer, friendly service. I feel like the food is better during normal hours, I popped in for a late burger one night and was a little bummed, but they made it up by taking half off my bill, (burger and 2 beers) 
Check it out! Great spot!

Not bad overall. the beer ws excellent, the salad was wilted, probably sitting for some time.  Service was slow, up to 10 minutes to get the order after walking in and another 10 for the beer to be delivered.  But you go there for the beer, and their KBS was unbeatable, porter and imperial stout was great.

Best beer bar in Phoenix! Very knowledgeable and friendly staff, one of the best burgers in the state, constantly changing craft beer list (all good)! Recent "change" in management has made this place way better. New decor looks great! Try the wings too!
The peel and eat shrimp were SO good! Totally unexpected here, but delicious and reminded me of eating giant fresh shrimp in Florida. Very good beer selection too!

Went there for delicious burgers on a Saturday night. Got to the top of the stairs to be informed by some poor staff person that this restaurant is charging a $10 cover because they're showing some UFC fight. WHAT. I guess I wasted that Lyft ride. 

They have a downstairs area (sacks) they've served folks in before. Never mind that it's super weird to charge a cover to watch tv, why didn't they just charge upstairs and not downstairs? We saw several other people leave disappointed. Wonder if they made enough from the cover to make up for the lost business that night and in the future.
Try the pizza or a burger.  Both are very good.  Nice upstairs patio!

Went here as I heard they had some amazing burgers. They certainly do! I ordered the hangover burger and my boyfriend ordered the ivan. Both were delicious! The fries that came with were also nice and crispy. I ordered my burger medium rare and unfortunately recieved it medium well. I'm not too snarky with burgers so I let that one go. 

The beer list is also pretty decent but pretty pricey as is the menu ($12-14 for a burger, around $7 for draft beer). I'm rating this place 3 stars as the burger was not how I ordered it and our waitress was somewhat slow and not as on the ball as I would have liked. Either way, cool place, nice seating, and a great atmosphere. Will definitely come back.

If I'm not down the street at The Wandering Tortoise, I'm here! Great beer selections always. Friendly and knowledgeable staff! Jerry is the BEST!!! One of the best patios and views of Camelback Mountain!

GREAT burgers. Seriously. And a great place to catch the game. But pretty poor service, unfortunately.  :(

Empty glasses, slow service, and even SLOWER wait to get the check. Someone needs to train the wait staff, and this would be an awesome place.
No exaggeration when I say..best burger in arizona. hands down.

The Burger at The Attic is one of those burgers you can judge on looks alone. A glistening patty of beef that sits atop a pretzel bun stacked with fresh and well thought out ingredients. The full list of ingredients consists of a bakery-fresh pretzel bun, 1/2 pound of juicy beef, spring mix, tomato, chipotle mayo, and your choice of cheese (and you have to add the optional bacon). The burger pairs many complementary flavors and a blend of sweet, savory, and spicy along with the combination of fresh premium ingredients will make your mouth water. I'd personally suggest adding on the bacon and selecting provolone cheese. The chipotle mayo does plenty to bring a little bit of kick for your tastebuds. Egg was offered as an upgrade/option but I believe it wouldn't do much to complement all the veggies on the burger, and it would make the entire burger unmanageable. This gem is like hitting the jackpot... easily the best burger in Phoenix.

Great beers...... Outstanding!!!But their award winning hamburger was way beneath our expectations. We will order something different next time...WAY over rated...but the beer selection was wonderful.

I was so excited to try this restaurant! My fiancé and I try a new restaurant every week in the arcadia area and The Attic was next on our list. We arrived there at 5:13pm and sat down at a table in the bar area. As I was viewing the menu to order a glass of wine, there wasn't much of a choice, but I got a glass of the Pino Grigio since I love wine so much. As we waited for my glass of wine, a conversation about baby veil started to take place around the bar. There were 3 gentlemen that started to talk about how awesome baby veil tasted. They went into great detail on how the animal is to be taken away from its mother, have its legs crushed so it can not walk, and put into a sealed container where the baby cow eats little to nothing while all of its muscle is eaten by its starving body. Not only did this conversation start and continue for the next 3 minutes loudly, but the bartender was also involved in the laughing discussion on how baby cows are mistreated to provide human consumption. I then asked for my check and let the bartender know that I was deeply disturbed by the conversation being taken place around the bar. She said nothing to me, and brought me my check right away. The conversation continued as my fiancé paid our bill and we left the establishment. We will never step foot into this establishment ever again. The thought will remain and shame on the staff to allow such conversation to take place and continue in a public environment.

I was recently convinced by a fellow bar patron that I needed to give The Attic another try and I am very glad that I listened to them. The service has improved dramatically since my previous visits that were the catalyst for my prior review. This visit the service was outstanding. Our server greeted us promptly, was super nice, was willing to answer all of our questions, and was very knowledgeable about the food and beer choices. I ordered the Ivan burger and fries, my friends the Sriracha burger, and side salad. Our food was served promptly and the place was pretty packed so that's saying something. As has always been the case, the food was amazing! I am really looking forward to going back to The Attic after this experience, and I am very happy that I gave this place another chance.

This is my go to Arcadia spot for rotating craft beers. They have 21 taps of non-AZ beers, for the most part you will see beers from breweries in CA or CO. The food is great! I come every Wednesday for the burger and beer special. They have featured amazing collaboration burgers with the likes of Little Miss BBQ. There is complimentary valet on busy nights, but I park on a side street if they have valet. Get the Ivan, everytime, all the time. And be sure to check in on Untappd, 100 check-ins for forever happy hour prices. Sunsets....camelback....TVs for days. Best place to go for sour beers at a reasonable price point. Wednesday's any beer and burger for only $10.
Great atmosphere and friendly staff.  Thursday night was a pizza and beer/wine fir $12, great deal and great pizza. Fantastic view from the second floor of Camelback Mountain.
I love coming here. Great beer great food and good service. I've been here a couple of times and am never disappointed. Look forward to going back soon!
Ivan burger with Swiss and sautéed mushrooms!!!  Amazing. We sat by the cozy patio fire. Service was very good and the food was great.

This place is kinda cool. You can look out from the patio to see what's happening down below. Burgers are OK.  Not the best I've tasted. They claim to have won some awards for the burgers. Good italian chopped salad.  One thing that is lacking is amount of staff.  They need a few more people working because the service was slow past two times I visited.  They are friendly enough and working hard, they just were at capacity I think.  My in-laws loved this place, so we came back twice. They love a good bar, for some this is it.

If you are a craft beer lover and have not been here you are missing out.  This is the best craft beer bar in Phoenix.  The selection changes daily and the food is fantastic.  This is the only place in town that you will find rare beer on a regular basis.  Ryan also had regular special events like tap take over crab boils that you don't want to miss.  This is a great little locally owned craft beer bar with awesome food.

Great spot looking out at camelback mountain.  They have an ever rotating selection of craft beers and knowledgeable, friendly bartenders.  The wings are very tasty.  

We're bringing a friend back because we had a great time.

Love this  place! Great to take newbies and beer lovers!! Their burgers are monstrous and MOST delicious!! It's a 'go to' when I face the question of 'where do you want to go?', 'I don't know....'  Don't get me wrong, it's definitely a place to go anytime too!!!!!!

Great ambiance (located upstairs with an outdoor balcony option).  Definitely bar food, but with a twist.  Pretty good food and an extensive beer list!  I believe that they rotate in different beers on tap.  Sat at the table straight ahead when you walk in against the wall.  Went with about six people and the service wasn't that great.  We waited quite some time for the server to come back.  We needed to ask for utensils because we weren't given any after the food arrived.  It definitely was not busy at the time.  I was a little disappointed.  Great food and place for dinner though.

Awesome beer selection and great burgers.  World famous?!?  Well, that's a bit of a stretch.  I think there are other burgers here in Phoenix that are just as good.  I'm not saying I've come across one that's much better, but definitely on the same level as this.  That being said, if you're looking for an amazing burger joint, this is one of them.  Pair it up with the awesome beer selection and that's what makes this place a cut above the rest.  It's a great location in a great neighborhood.  Prices are fairly reasonable but anytime you go above the $10 mark for a burger, it's a problem.

Stopped in for a drink and some quick dinner. The restaurant wasn't too crowded and there seemed to be a good amount of staff. I ordered a pizza and it took over a hour to get it. Many restaurants would offer a discount or at least send over a manager but we got nothing of the sort except for a "sorry it's taking so long". They have a great beer selection and decent food but just know the wait can be very long. Can't imagine weekends here.

Great burger! Came here on a Wednesday and their special is a burger and draft beer for $10. They have a wide variety of beers. Very casual attire. Some tv's but wouldn't come here for a game. Once again, GREAT BURGER!
Nice rooftop venue. Great beer selection with reasonable prices and the food was good. I would recommend the pizza or Ivan burger. Both delicious.
Went there on a Saturday night, amazing food and beer. Great service and chill atmosphere. I would suggest the wings and a burger. Amazing! Thank you :)

Went there last night with a party of 26, called ahead to let them know and they had a table ready for us in the downstairs restaurant. Was given Excellent service and the buffalo burger was awesome. We will be going back there again soon

Umm....$12 for a pint and a pretzel bun 1/2 pound burger....yup...thats 5 stars.

Service was great, view was great, food was great.

My wife and I are going back next wednesday!

The Ivan Burger is the best burger I've ever had...honestly, it's better than doing the no pants dance.

No, really. Eat the burger, then hit the good foot, do the bad thing, and compare the experiences. You'll look at the other participant with disappointment that they weren't the hamburger you previously devoured.
OMG! What an awesome burger!! The Ivan with chipotle mayo is amazing!! My family and I had friendly customer service from start to finish!!

Loved this place.
The Ivan Burger is delicious.
Great service
Great beers
Will be a frequent stop for me

Our server was freaking amazing and funny.   Didn't catch her name.  The food was over the top.   Holmburger is where it's at,  but you might need a shower afterwards.   Can't wait to go back and try more!

Why the stars??? I'll tell you that it wasn't for the service, mellow atmosphere, or the great burger. It was for the lack of local brews. There are several good locals that would probably benefit from being on tap in a place like this. The craft beer industry is a small industry and needs to grow. Only through local support will this happen. Everywhere in the east coast and west coast there are specialty burger places that serve local crafts, and sometimes exclusively local. I wish I had seen the same here. Great potential to tap into this emerging market yet it is unrealized.

Aside from that the burger was excellent and the fries were "meh". The bartender was nice and knew her beers.

Been here three times for their burger and the first time the burger was fantastic but the next two times it wasn't worth what I paid for it. Both times the burger was very greasy and with so much butter it was almost all I could taste. If you like grease and butter this burger is for you.
For $14 bucks I wouldn't recommend it when compared to the litany of restaurants that surround the place.

The Burgers are amaaaaazing and there's a great selection of interesting micro-brews on tap.

Come hungry - the burgers are huge! My hubbie and I had the Ivan Burgers - Top-grade beef, perfectly cooked to order and piled high with classic toppings like greens, onion and tomato with a creamy aioli and your choice of cheese. For $1 add other toppings like bacon on sauteed mushrooms. 

Sit at the bar and get friendly service with views of Camelback mountain.

I found this place through the Arizona Beer week event.  I wanted to try something new for my birthday so I thought I'd give this place a shot.  It is appropriately called the Attic because it is on the top floor of a two-story building.  When you walk in there is a small lounge seating area.  To the left you walk in and see the tiny kitchen that is open for guests to see.  The floor plan is long and narrow with dim lighting and tables on either side against the walls.  The bar is on the left and has seating on the inside and on the outside where there is a good sized balcony with a walled fireplace and tables as well as a bar height top with seating along the outside parameter of the balcony.  I tried the Ivan burger.  This is probably the best burger I have ever had!  It is 1/2 lb. beef burger with your choice of cheese. It is simple and comes with red onions, tomato, and dark green lettuces, and it has a creamy chipotle mayo all on a pretzel bun.  So juicy it melts in your mouth.  It also, comes with sweet potato fries which are also good.  I had the pleasure of meeting the Owner and creator of the Ivan, (named after him of course).  The rare beers they had on tap for the beer event were really good also,  I was very happy that I chose The Attic to go to and enjoy for the evening.   If you are looking for a great burger you must go to the Attic!

We had heard a lot of hype about The Attic and finally checked it out.  The good: The Ivan burger was huge and flavorful and the pretzel bun was a great touch.  Nice selection of craft beers, including some relatively rare finds.  The not-so-good: indifferent service from the only server working the room. A manager asked if our drink orders had been taken (they had) as he noticed that we had nothing but water after we had been seated for quite some time.  Fries came cold, as if they had been cooked well before the burger.  Two burgers/two beers with tip was over $40.  Not worth the $ when paired with poor service. I would only consider a return on a Wednesday when burger/beer combo is offered for $10.

This is a great little place that serves up awesome, juicy burgers and has a rockin' beer selection. They used to have this insane deal on Wednesday evenings: $10 for the Ivan burger (most popular) and a pint of beer. But the last time we went I think it had changed...maybe $5 off a beer and burger combo. Hey, I'm not complaining, a deal's a deal. And it seems like the Wednesday crowd has lightened. They have an excellent patio with a great view of Camelback. Ask for a side of their homemade ranch--you will want to swim in it. Fries are excellent too. Great service and plentiful beer options.

Early review of the Ivan Burger. Solid. Pretzel rolls scare me b/c they tend to be too dense. This one was just right. Only issue was the burger was a bit oversalted and i'd say hold the mayo/aioli. Otherwise, definitely worth the trip!

I had an amazing burger on one of The Attic's Wednesday burger nights and must have it again! It was called the Dim Sum burger but it is not on the menu anymore. Can I still order it? 

I loved the patio and reading some of these other reviews reminded me that my server was Cheryl and she was indeed terrific! The food was delicious and I enjoyed the overall experience.

Now if I could just find out if I can get the Dim Sum burger again? Thanks, Ivan, if you are able to respond to this review.

The burgers here have not lost taste that's forsure ! Every bite is enjoyable and gushing with flavors ! 
Service is great as well as the environment ! 
Always happy to come back !

Excellent rotating beer list.  Every time I'm in, there's something new and delicious on tap.  Happy hour food specials are great, tacos are delicious, and burgers are delicious as always.  Happy Dillon is back in the kitchen!

I came here for the Wed night 10 burger/beer night deal.  I was really excited for this place and wasn't disappointed on the whole experience, however a few things fell short to bring my rating down a bit. We got the wings to start on top of the burger/beer deal to get our engines starting. I'm a huge fan of wings and if cooked properly with a good sauce can satisfy me the rest of the meal. I asked for my Arcadia Wings to be extra crispy. Unfortunately the wings were not at all. Though tasty and flavorful it didn't have the bite that I asked for. Next were the burgers. We both got the Ivan's and asked for medium. By the time we got them they were  almost well done. A little dry for my taste which makes a burger not a burger. What saved the night was the pretzel bun. If the wings/burger came out as I asked this place would have been epic, but fell short based on those two items. Maybe just a bad night for the staff.

It is easy to miss this rooftop restaurant off of Indian School but it is worth a stop if you are looking for great views and upscale bar food. With camelback mountain in the distance, the patio is the perfect place to enjoy one of their many craft brews while waiting for wings or a burger. While the food is good, the Ivan burger (apparently rated one of the top in the country) is the star of the show. The only thing that could use improvement is the service, which left much to be desired!

I LOVE this place. The burgers are the best I have had and their appetizers are amazing. The Brie and Candied Pancetta Bruschetta is beyond fabulous. We come often on Wed. for $10 burger and beer. The beer list always changes but is always good. And the burgers, speechless, they are just amazing
Awesome food, staff, beer, and atmosphere.  Way to go Ryan and Ivan

Always a great selection of beer, we went on a Friday for a special event....6 beers from Goose Island and Deschutes Class of 88 release.  Both of us had the fish fry, though I am not sure either one of us had the walleye, I think both were perch.  But still pretty good.  The flight was not what I expected, but we really enjoyed the Bourbon beer.  A good pils with the fish rounded out the evening nicely.  It was packed as expected, no valet, had to park across the street.  No evidence of the brewery personnel being on site with swag, as was publicized.  That was disappointing.  Overall not the greatest experience and not up to the usual expectations of this place.  Generally it's our go to favorite.

This place is the bomb!  Great outdoor patio.  Fun and friendly staff! Very knowledgable of their food.  I was told that it was a great burger by the cute waiter.  It wasn't a great burger, IT WAS A FANTASTIC BURGER!!!!  I will be back again soon as it is on my way home from work.  The patio was great, watched a beautiful sunset.  They also had misters going and was nice to sit outside.
Hidden gem where you can relax, eat, and drink. The pizza is amazing and the beer selection is great also.

I ate here one night and I spent three weeks in the hospital. Not only did I have diarrhea but I had a very high fever, I will never eat here again. Perhaps my experience was unique but no one should ever get this violently ill from a burger.

Went there again because we had such a wonderful experience with the best server last time (the sweet brunette girl who really knew her stuff and was a great server)... This time however was the first time in my life my boyfriend and I actually got up and left prior to putting in an order. This completely rude and bitchy blonde waitress knew nothing about the menu and was visibly irritated at our simple questions- do you still have the peach Belgium beer? Which wings are the crispy ones that are not as messy as usual wings? We had these things last time so we wanted them again without looking at the menu. Her answers: beer- whatever Is on the menu, ok which is most like that one then since its not on the menu anymore- i don't know, whatever is on the back was her reply.  wings- whatever is on the menu, ummmm that would be the dry ones- mind you we didnt even look at menu cuz we just wanted what we had Last time. When we asked if they had iced tea and whether it was sweetened or unsweetened she rolled her eyes like too many questions or something. Her entire demeanor sucked. Shes a server and those were basic restaurant questions so that we could have what we had last time, nothing she should have been so visibly annoyed about.  We believe in positive energy so we left and went to Sushi Brokers instead. Please fire that rude server- I wish I had gotten her name. Turned a wonderful experience at a new place right down the road to a place we will need to decide if we will go to again. Their food is excellent but depending on the server, your experience may not be worth it.

This is a good brew house, with good beers and nice appetizers. My main complaint is that despite many unusual draughts, The Attic charges $.50 for a taste/sampling for any of the beers. Really?  Very bush league business practice. Shows a lack of respect for the clientele. Won't be back, won't recommend until they quit pinching fractions of pennies.  Too bad, as otherwise we liked it.

So good that I can only ask that you stay away so that it is not busy or crowded for me!

LOL

Kicks the ass of the Acadia Tavern any day of the week!

Date night at this second story wine & beer spot with freshly prepared food.

We stop in for a light dinner & drinks and are invited to sit where we like.  We get the last indoor high top table with a glimpse to the outside patio.  

The charcuterie & cheese plates were awesome!  The charcuterie featured at least 4 meats, pickles, artichokes, and a horseradish cheese.  The cheese plate had half an apple, 3 cheeses including an herb cheddar and Brie.  This was served with seeded crackers and crostini straws.  I subtracted a star because they did not explain the charcuterie or cheese types to us and it does not detail the cheese selections on the menu.

I enjoyed chatting in the lively weeknight environment and our service was just enough to be taken care of.  We never had an empty water glass and never felt rushed.

I've always had good service and good food at The Attic, until tonight.  We popped in for a drink, found a nice pair of seats outside on the balcony, and waited.  And waited...  After 10 minutes one of the staff who brought out food for someone else saw us and took pity on us, so we ordered our drinks, and waited.  And waited...  After another 10 minutes went by we decided that being ignored by and not being served by the staff was a big waste of our time.  The irony is: we were only about 3 feet from the bar, and the actual waiter for the area walked past several times, but never even looked at us.  Come on Attic, you weren't that crowded.  You used to be a lot better, our money went elsewhere tonight.

This is hands down the best burger in Phoenix!  They have the best beer selection around. The manager is awesome and super accommodating.  It is a kid friendly establishment.  Just overall a great dining experience!  A hidden gem no doubt!

UPDATE: we did indeed try this spot again, and I'm glad to say we had a great time! Great service, amazing burgers and pizza, reasonably priced, great location! Definitely sit outside, there's very few times in AZ that you're able to without dying of heatstroke :) Thanks for a great experience everyone 






Love the location, loved the appetizers and bottle of wine half off on Sunday's!! What I didn't love....... Have you ever had a waitress who is very attentive and friendly? But then it turns into OVERLY attentive and friendly to where it ruins your experience? Oh my. 

I'm all for up-selling as I have been a waitress, but there's a difference from up-selling and basically badgering every time you come by the table. I couldn't enjoy my bottle of wine. My husband was also getting irritated with her. I'm sorry but you shouldn't come by our table literally once every 3-5 minutes trying to get us to order something else. 

After we ordered wine and an app, "this app is also great, wanna order with your wine?" "no thanks, we're just relaxing and will order more in a bit." Five minutes later-- "Wanna order another bottle of wine? Your entree?" "Nope, we will let you know." 3 minutes later-- "what entrees are you looking at and I can tell you more?" Husband asks opinion. She says, "I'd recommend this, alright should I put the order in?!" WTF, NO!!! I clearly said I wasn't ready 3 mins prior, and I'd like to eat dinner with my husband when we're both ready! Why is that so complicated? The entire time went exactly like this and we were literally there maybe an hour.. Not all day or anything. It's very annoying and makes me question whether your food is worth it to even come back. Writing this made me more angry and I bumped it from 3 to a 2 star.

UPDATE: Came here by myself July 9th late afternoon for my burger drug. 
Every INDOOR table was taken but luckily some friends were there so I joined them! (Patio was still free.) This Wed. special had The Mountain Burger included. Ham, BACON, fried onions, BBQ sauce, tomato, lettuce, pepperjack cheese. I saw that listing and there was no question I had to have it! And it arrived in under 10 minutes!!
BAM!
It was gigantic. I opened wide and shoved the burger in for that BIG first bite! 
Church was now in session!
Best. Burger. Ever.
The Mountain Burger created a hill which was my belly.

I gotta tell you... these guys are really doing everything right and making a good case to bring people back - and they're succeeding!  I've watched over the past year (from living in the neighborhood) the snowball effect of more and more 'regulars' and more and more smiles in the restaurant.  
My opinion is 3 simple things will bring you back to an establishment:
1)  Good Service
2)  Good Food & Drink
3)  A memorable, positive experience each time you're there
My wife and I continue to be impressed each and every time we go in.  Frankly, they are really finding their rhythm with an unmatched and constantly revolving beer taps, a food menu that is diverse and centered around quality and an ambiance with their patio/TVs, and bar area that is very intriguing and compelling to stick around.  
Bottom line:  It's a craft beer place - first and foremost.  There are At LEAST 20 different beers you'll likely NOT find anywhere else.  If you're OK with traditional beers at traditional sports bars, taverns or medium priced restaurants - that's OK, because their knowledgeable staff will guide you to what you're palate is thirsting for.  My wife likes wine - and they can help you with that, too.  The food menu provides a good range of 'comfort', 'healthy' and 'unique' - but all fresh and the utmost quality.
My personal favorites:  Taco Tuesday, Burger Night Wednesday and Sunday (at 10AM) for their unbelievable breakfast choices!  Seriously - where are you going to find that diversity at ANY other craft beer restaurant!?  
Ultimately, you'll need to give it a try for yourself - leave it up to them to prove to you like they did my wife and I - that you'll want to go back!

I finally had the pleasure of dining at The Attic with a small group of friends.  Overall, I'm quite pleased.  The place is cute.  Service was good, our waitress was happy to climb on the table to turn down our fan when we got a little chilly.  She was very genuine with her opinions of the menu and was very excited about her favorites, so we felt confident when we placed our orders.  

I had the Ivan burger because I keep hearing great things about it and the menu boasted some kind of "top burger" award.  It was good, for sure.  But I wouldn't put it at number one. Top 10 maybe.  It had all the traditional toppings, including a chipotle aioli that wasn't too spicy for the likes of me.  The beef was tender and cooked just right.  I took half home, and it warmed up the next day to almost the same quality it originally was... that's the mark of a good burger!

The happy hour is pretty good with discounted beer (long list of options), wine, and appetizers.

The Attic isn't really in my neighborhood so I don't think I'll be a regular, but I wouldn't say no to a return trip!
Awesome food and Cheryl was the best. Will go back just to see her again!  She provided excellent tips on beer choices! Highly recommend and make sure to ask for Cheryl!

This place is good!!  Really nice inside atmosphere and when the weather finally cools down, their outdoor patio and fireplace look to be very inviting.   Drinks were plentiful and some of the biggest hamburgers I've encountered.   Very reasonably priced.

THE BEST BURGER!!
The vibe of this place is relaxed and I love it. Awesome views of Camelback mountain. The staff are great and the beer and wine selections are on point. 1/2 price wine bottles on Sunday make me happy.
I advise sharing the Ivan burger unless you haven't eaten for a few days. ;)

Sooooooo good! Fantastic burgers, great pizza, delicious beer! Such an awesome beer selection, there is something for every taste.  Service was great too!  I wish I didn't live in Mesa so this could be my go to bar.  Seriously great food and great beer.

Food was ok, service and overall atmosphere was awful. No air circulating in 115 degree weather makes for an unenjoyable dining experience. The server didn't know what I was ordering off of their Sunday special menu because he "just got there." For how few guests were there, it took quite a bit of time for the food to arrive. The burger tasted decent enough but was spicier than I imagined it would be and the sour I had ordered definitely doesn't pair well with spicy. We tried multiple times to get the server (or any server's) attention so I could order something to wash it down but he didn't make it back to our table for 15 minutes after our food had arrived and we were done eating. There was little acknowledgment when we were headed out after paying, either. Overall, very lackadaisical and underwhelming service. 

I won't be back-- I'll spend $40 on a meal somewhere that has personable staff and chilly A/C next time.

Met some friends for a late dinner and drinks. This was our first time at this restaurant. Small space but we didn't have to wait for a table. Fairly loud inside. It was difficult to hear the conversation between the 4 of us. Most of us had the Ivan burger. I have to say... It was pretty darn good. Hubby hates the chairs. He said they were pretty uncomfortable but they didn't bother me. Beer bear and more beer. So good. They have a patio with a fireplace. Once the weather is nice I would like to come back and try it out. Since its on the second floor of the building it would be nice to sit outside and enjoy the people watching.
Beer good, buffalo burger good, service ok, noise ugh, unbearable.   That is my only problem.   Never was part of the conversation as it was so loud.  Will wait until weather is cooler to go outside.

Pleasantly surprised! The food was pretty darn good. My SO and I both had burgers and we both impressed! The meat was quality and the toppings were well thought out and tasty. The chipotle mayo was well paired with the burger and I even dipped my fries in it. The atmosphere was comfortable and not too pretentious and prices were reasonable. The view is amazing and I would certainly return.

My first visit and if I didn't have a GPS equipped cyber-phone, I'd be seriously lost Don Quixote-style. But I did find it and trotted up the stairs to the bar. My first impression was that this is a little oddly shaped establishment, but I have a feeling that there are some regulars here. Dipsomaniacs in need of social interaction, aren't we all at times?

The Beer diversity and level of interest
The beers are interesting, but the diversity is skewed. I still liked it though, but two of the beers I wanted to try, they were out of. That quite a lot on a list that contains 12 beers. I want more beers on the list! 

The Service
There is a cute blond behind the bar, and she is working perpetually. She has no need to check in on you and your needs to quench your thirst, so if you want her attention you need to speak up, flag her down. She was clearly unimpressed by the jokes from the peanut gallery, disregarding if it was an homage to her beauty or a annoying applause as she accidentally displaced glassware into the bar or the floor. I cannot imagine working where people stare at me all day. It would be like working in an aquarium - if we disregard the humidity. In regards to the knowledge of the beers, I didn't feel that I was dealing with a brew pundit. 

Conclusion
I did enjoy this place, and time just went extraordinarily fast in here. They do have a rotation and will be getting even more interesting beers on the menu, and that will be very nice to experience. But if I wouldn't already known anyone here, I don't feel the atmosphere is such as I would strike up a conversation with strangers in my lonesomeness.

Not the best selections of beer types among quite a few taps on the list. Asked for my fries well done which they said they'd do and didn't. I also got fewer fries than my table mates. That being said they were ok and the pulled pork was good and also large. The burgers the rest of my family had looked very good. 

WAY too loud. Would not return unless I made sure there wasn't any sports for idiots to scream over on the many TV sets here and the blazingly loud speakers. Too small a space for the noise to bounce around in.

Great waitress.

The. Best. Burger. I. Have. Ever. Had. We're visiting here and one of our friends recommended the attic knowing we are burger lovers. I got the Ivan and my husband got the hangover. We both enjoyed every bite of our juicy burgers with the perfect fixings.

May I give negative stars?  After a long week of coordinating 700 state tests for my school, I felt that I had earned a nice break, so happy hour at the Attic it was!  My friend does barre classes nearby and suggested the place.  I had high expectations- I could say I was disappointed, but that would be an understatement.  When I left there I had intimate knowledge of what it feels like to be treated like a third class citizen. My friend and I were blatantly disrespected by not one, not two, but THREE different employees. They didn't even try to feign any sort of semblance of customer service. I've been to some pretty sub-par places with so-so food and crappy service, but this, by far, was the worst experience I have ever had ANYWHERE.   IT took me a good week to stop being aggressively  pissed off. I can't say anything to the quality of the food because we never got that far, but I can say that if you're feeling masochistic, this is a great choice.  Yours truly, a great lover of a good glass of Pinot (gasp) left an almost full glass there to be poured down the drain.  The saddest part of my whole experience is that they don't even care. The older blonde hostess (who looked to be the manager) didn't even try to pretend to care. This is not some 5 star elite restaurant-and I've been to some- and they certainly don't treat people like this.   I feel it is my duty to warn people to stay away from this place.  Check out Oh-So or Postino or even Chick Fil A for that matter.  Trust me you'll be glad you did. :(.  Still pissed -and it's been a couple weeks.   I live in this area, and trust me I will never set foot in this place again. EVER


Someone requested to know more of the story, here is a kind of synopsis:
Let's see, how to trim down the convoluted story -here it is is a nutshell:  
They knowingly, and rather arrogantly decided to seat another couple before us (the gentleman was wearing scrubs, READ:  doctor)  Then they argued about it (two people).  I saw the couple actually walk up the stairs and my friend's name was already written on their chalkboard.  But, NO, they were right!  Not the couple mind you, the employees!
The waitress/bartender threw our change at us (literally) and said some snarky comments as she walked away (mind you, this is all while we're sitting on the "waiting" bench.)  The manager and the other hostess OPENLY talked about us and pointed at us and proceeded to argue with us as we walked out - as we finally made a smart decision and left.  When I left and the valet guy asked how our night was, I asked him if we were on a hidden camera show.  
I told one of my other friends about it and she found a blog called "How I became a douchebag diner".  Google it, that pretty much is a parallel to our feelings as we left, but of course more eloquently put.

By far the best things about this place are its Wednesday burger special, its beer list, and the patio view. Try to get there early, as it gets pretty crowded (the parking lot, in particular, fills up really fast).

Tip: Ask for a side of chipotle mayo to dip your fries in. It really takes them to the next level.

I had the best experience here recently! Service was great, they have seasonal beers, and the patio is very pleasant this time of year. They also have this amazing bruschetta (with cheese, pico de gallo and bacon) which is a perfect balance of flavors!

Delicious! I had the infamous "Ivan" for the first time tonight. This wondrous mound of meat along with a cold pilsner was the highlight of my day. 

The beef patty was thick and made exactly how I ordered it. I added a side of avocado because I like it on my burger. 

The Attic is small inside and parking is limited, but our party of 3 had no problem finding a table at 7pm on a Monday. 

If you're looking for a good burger, I recommend giving this place a try.

Holy cow the IVAN Burger is the best burger I have ever had in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area.  Outstanding.  Just come here and buy it.  They have a Burger & Beer deal on Wednesdays ... I feel like this burger is good enough to come weekly and enjoy.

Besides the burger, The Attic has Great service and Good Happy Hour Deals.

The only things to watch out for:
The patio is deserted in the summer.  I wish it could be covered more or have some more misters.  Because of that, it can get pretty crowded inside.  I bet when it's not the summer the patio is great though.  I've heard parking can be a pain, but I didn't experience that when I was there.  

Overall, this is an amazing find and I can't wait to return for another Happy Hour soon!
Great wine selection and good food. The fish tacos are good and I love their fries! They have good service and valet parking.

I called the restaurant in November to see if I could reserve the patio for a bridal party dinner. I was given Ivan's name and number as he was the manager and the one I would work with to arrange the event which took place in late January. I figured two months was plenty of notice and, if the restaurant could not accommodate my group of 15-20 people, the manager would let me know.  I had been to the Attic with my friend before (the bride) and I know it is quite "cozy" (small) but I figured, if we could reserve the space ahead of time, all would be good. SO, after speaking with Ivan at least three times over the course of the last two months, we show up to the restaurant the day of only to find that we do not have a reservation. It was as if they had no idea we were coming! They seated us at their largest table near the entrance which wasn't large enough to accommodate the entire party. I asked our totally overwhelmed server if Ivan was around and she went to get him. When he comes over, I remind him of my name and that we had previously spoken on the phone and that he had assured me that the outside patio would be available to accommodate our party.  His response was "I will see what I can do". 20 minutes later, he has set up tables and chairs for us outside, however, there is still not enough seating for everyone and it was a very tight squeeze with all of the other patrons who were on the patio.  It was clear that my party was somewhat of an annoyance to Ivan's other guests (not our intentions, whatsoever!).  We had to wait for another party of 4 to finish their meal before everyone in our group could have a seat. In addition, it was also clear that the restaurant was not expecting such a large group because our waitress and servers seemed very overwhelmed. It took a couple of my friends 20-30 minutes and multiple reminders to receive their drink orders.  We were at the restaurant for over 4 hours before our meal was finished. That being said, most everyone I spoke with enjoyed their meal and, once we were comfortably seated, the atmosphere was enjoyable.  I think the servers and kitchen did everything they could to make the night go as smoothly as possible and I understand how difficult it is working with such a large group.  The reason I am giving the Attic 2 our of 5 stars is that, while Ivan was able to literally "squeeze" us in at the last minute, there was no apology; no acknowledgement that he had inconvenienced any of us as well as other customers of his on the patio that night. My advice, if you do choose to come here, is to come with no more than 4 people and don't bother calling in advance.

Very good place, the restaurant is on the second floor of the building, hence the name "The Attic".  My girlfriend and I saw the reviews and the menu and we had to try it out, safe to say we are not disappointed with the service and food both are high quality. My girlfriend got the Southern Fried Chicken Burger, the chicken was tender full of flavor. I got the "The Ivan" which highly rated in this place very delicious as well. Outside setting was gorgeous and nice calm. I like this place and will defenetly come back.

EXCEPTIONAL. 

I ordered the Ivan Burger for pick up at 10:55 pm on a Friday, medium. My order was ready in 10 minutes. I am curious yet skeptical by nature so when I read the claim that The Ivan Burger is in the top 5 of burgers in the world I thought Id give it a shot. Happy to say my skepticism was pulverized!. Coming from Los Angeles there are a lot less gastropub "foodie" type places in Phoenix than I am used to and I am glad I found this place. 

The bar was cool, the staff was friendly, and it was very clean. The crowd is pretty mellow but definitely there to drink. They have an ample bar with a lot of craft option. The only Con is that it was kind of confusing to find. Hint: it's called the attic because it is built into like a loft section of a commercial building.

TLDR: Order the Ivan Burger. Go up stairs.

Super friendly staff.   Delicious variety of meads and local beers.   Wonderful view of Camelback.   Lots of people at happy hour but not overly crowded.   We came on Wednesday and they have $5 off burgers when you order a beer.   Very good time!

FINALLY!!!!

A gastropub that not only has mouthwatering food but also great customer service. I'm a beer snob and have no problem admitting it. It's really frustrating to find a place that has great food and great hospitality. (Also with a fantastic beer selection)

My husband and I walked in on 04/18/15 at around 11:20am to grab a bite to eat and something to quench our thirst. We decided to sit at the bar because it was just opening time and figured we would talk to our server/ bartender. SHOUT OUT TO LINDSAY!!! She's been the first person to just talk with us... about the craft brew scene, traveling to different breweries and other awesome beer related stuff. 

Then the food came... I ordered the Holmbuger?? I believe was its mythical name. It was beefy, it was spicy, it was sweet, it was juicy... it was just heaven between two pretzel buns. 

Needless to say we WILL be back because it's not just good food that makes a great place, it's the people that work there and care.

ALSO SHOUT OUT to the guy wearing the Sriracha Shirt (you know who you are) who asked us if we were happy with everything while we were walking out. The fact that this guy sincerely cared about our experience made me want to write this review and give this place the 5 stars it deserves. 

Thank you,
Kerrie
Best burgers around and great rotating beer selections. Not to mention a fantastic view of Camelback Mt.

The best burgers in town! I also love the great selection of craft beers they have on tap. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because there is one female server who has a bad attitude (and we've had her as our server multiple times).
Great place tucked away with a fantastic view of Camelback, a great craft beer selection, and some very tasty food. Perfect place to meet some friends and chill out over some good food.

I have to say I've been on a burger binge for the last 2 months and I have to give my honest opinion about the Attic, it wasn't the greatest burger I've ever had.  I went there on Saturday evening and there was only one cook and the burger showed because of it. The bun was the only good thing, I also paid a dollar more for the grass fed beef, couldn't tell the difference.  Service was slow and if the burger was built up to what "they" say it was then a slow service would have been forgiven. After reading the name "the attic ale house". Well that should have said it all.

Pretty cool place.  A little hard to find, not a sign that is easily visible from the street or at least not that I saw.  But cool place upstairs.  very nice people that worked there and served us.  I had two beers, the honey and a strawberry.  I liked the honey a lot. Was very crisp.  For the burger I ended up ordering the Holsom burger sorry i forgot what the name of it was and no menu online. They need a website.  Well the burger had bacon, candied jalapenos, some crack sauce, pepper jack (i got it with cheddar), lettuce tomato and grilled onions all on a pretzel bun.  Needs the stiff bun or it would disintegrate a regular one.  Very good burger, not the best i have had, especially for the price.  Why the i gave 3 star rating.  Maybe give it 3.5.  Good, but not great.  I'd come back..

This place was recommended by a friend. Great recommendation indeed!

The atmosphere was great, it felt like I was out of town like in a real big city - if you know what I mean. 

Service was outstanding. Our server was very friendly, always made sure to check in and at the same time gave us our space. Wonderfull!

Food, I had mussels and as picky i am with sea food - I would order them again for sure. We also shared a pretzel and it was great! Prices are reasnoble as well.  

I am looking forward to a cooler weather outside to be able to seat on their beautiful patio.

1st visit:

Group of 8. Varying tastes.

Great beer selection. Very good food. Service was friendly, but not expert. Good atmosphere. Recommend outdoor at sunset.
Get the bruschetta for gods sake !! Also always, always get Cheryl at the bar for your daily dose of amazing bar service

I could go on about the epic burger, the fantastic service, the views, constant rotating taps, etc. or I could say that it's the perfect neighborhood hangout for beer heads...  But if I did those things you would all want to go and then I would never get a seat... So I will remain silent and hope for the best.

Was craving "the best burger in Phoenix" and polled my network online for recommendations. The Attic came up repeatedly as a reco, so the boif & I decided to make the trek across town to give it a whirl. Amazing burger, although I have to say I think the fries are even better. 100% satisfied and glad we tried something new tonight for dinner. The pizza looked and smelled amazing. May need to return to give that a try!  Of note: Tuesday night is Happy Hour all night with an extensive craft beer selection and discounted apps. Wednesdays are $10 burger + beer special.

I've eaten here many times, mainly because we liked the restaurant prior to it becoming the Attic.  I will admit the food is really good, the beers are great, and the decor is my style.  

So why the two stars then?   

The biggest problem this place has is customer service.  It is poor, at best.  The two times we have been there the staff were either rude or they ignored their tables.  Very well could have been understaffed but it happened twice.  This is a real shame because the food is excellent and I love the location.  The only thing keeping me from coming back is the poor service I've experienced both times I've been there.

This place has been on my list for about 7 months.  Due to their hours and location I just haven't been able to get over here until now.  The Attic is a great spot on the south side of Indian School and 44th St.  It seats around 30 people I would estimate.  Great patio looking directly at Camelback mountain.  

We ordered the meat platter, a pretzel with hot mustard, and the Ivan burger.  The meat platter for two was huge and consisted of prosciutto, cappicola, salami, red bell peppers, pickles, crackers, bread, and cheese.  It was pretty good.  I would have liked some olives and figs to add some sour and sweet to the plate.

The hot pretzel came out fresh and to our surprise it was Asian hot mustard not regular mustard.  The Ivan burger was very big with a huge pretzel bun.  It was very very good.  Fresh, juicy, and good toppings.  I cant say its the best burger Ive had in AZ but I would never turn it down that's for sure.

This was enough food for three people to share and still be full.

The beer selection was the highlight for me.  21 beers on tap and no BS domestic listed.  This is how its done future restaurateurs.  Take notes.  I enjoyed a Stone enjoy by and it was outstanding.

I am looking forward to coming back again and trying out some other items and taps.  Wish they opened earlier during the week for lunch and Id be back sooner.

It would have been 5 stars if not for a few issues: valet parking is not convenient when the parking lot is so close by, our beer menu was filthy, the waitress didn't fill up our drinks the entire time and it took a while for our food, not a full bar service.

Still the best burger in town - bar none. Great beers and service too. The value on Wednesday is exceptional. We shared an app, an Ivan, and I had two great pilsners for $25 before tip. Wings were a but rubbery, but tasty.
Love this place. Great service, good food, great selection of drinks! The Two Brothers Pizza is great and their burgers are great too.

I'm not really a burger person but I find myself craving the burger from The Attic! The pretzel bun is wonderful and the burger was just perfect. It was cooked medium and was not at all greasy, which is my usual gripe with burgers. The patio is very fun and I like looking over Indian School. The Happy Hour specials were decent and I was pleased with the selection that they have for drinks. Our server was friendly and attentive. I'm excited to come back and try more food. If I like all of it as much as I liked the burger, I might bump my rating up to 5 stars!

We LOVED the burgers here, but i had heard some scary stories from ppl who had worked there. I ignored these stories and continued eatiing there until i got food poisoning. Threw up every hour, all night long. Super disappointing :(
Good selection of beer, good food, nice 2nd story patio.  Chill atmosphere,  TVs and good music.

If you're a beer lover, go to the Attic Ale House. Their taps are always rotating and I don't think I've seen the same beer menu there at all (and I've gone a couple times in one week). Although I'm not super impressed with their pretzel on the app menu, their bruschetta is delicious and so are their pizzas and burgers. They often have specials (i.e., special price for a beer and burger, or beer and pizza, etc) and they're totally worth it. It's a fun atmosphere with a patio that overlooks Camelback. It has a ton of TVs if you're also looking for a fun place to watch a game (without having to go to a huge place). It can get pretty crowded during big games though, so plan accordingly.

Great location with a nice patio and view of Camelback mountain.  Wide selection of unique beers. The wings I had were pretty good. I wasn't hungry enough to order the huge burger that looked awesome as it kept passing by. Enough tv's to catch a game. Downside was that service was slow enough to be kind of annoying. Other than night, nice place to come chill for a little bit.

Pretty good beer selection, food is decent but not mind blowing, but the space is awkward and parking is sometimes quite difficult. We have been here a couple of times, and it's pretty consistent, which is also nice.

Came in town to visit family for my bday and decided to stop here. It was burger day so we got Holmsburgers and a Sicilian Pizza  and they both were really good! The waiter was nice and attentive and we really enjoyed ourselves. Would recommend to anyone.

Amazing beer selection. Orgasmic food. Outstanding service - seriously one of the better spots in Phoenix. Try the holmburger. Jordan was our server and she was great and knew the menu up and down. Oh and did I mention - killed patio!! A must stop when visiting arcadia.
Such a good find. The rotating tap and bottle list is very impressive. Burgers are great. Wednesday nights are the best for their weekly specials.

The Attic has great food and a great beer selection.  Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the service was slow (although friendly).  It seemed that they only had one person waiting tables on a Saturday at 1pm, so I understand that she was a little busy.  The bruschetta appetizer is DELICIOUS - would highly recommend.
Enjoyed burgers and fish tacos with beer while sitting on the patio watching a monsoon roll in. This place is within walking distance so as the weather cools I know I will be back often.

One of my favorite food and beer places in the valley. I've been here several times over the last year and always appreciate the friendly service and the consistently quality food. The only downside is it is a bit of a drive from my residence. My favorite item would be the Ivan burger, it's a substantial and tasty burger. On a side note I went to their Boulevard Brewery event last night as I saw they would be serving Kansas City style barbecue. I had the brisket sandwich with potato salad and mac and cheese, that was some of the best barbecue I've had! The brisket was well cooked with great taste and consistency. Hopefully they make barbecue a regular part of the menu at some point in the future. I am a fan of the Attic and I enjoy being a customer!

A friend and I decided to check out this place after work since it was close. As the name suggests, the Attic is not found on the ground floor! Walk up the stairs to the second floor and you'll find the Attic. The sign that greets you says to seat yourselves, so we chose prime seats on the patio overlooking Camelback Mountain. Happy hour is 4-6:30pm, Mondays through Fridays, and features $2 off all appetizers, $1.50 off beer by the glass, and $2 off wine by the glass. The beer selection changes frequently and there's a decent wine list (I got a Moscato and my friend got a cider). For food, we ordered the fish tacos (a bit cold) and the bruschetta with pancetta (good flavor, but a bit cold). Service was fair, not awful, not stellar. 

Solid place to hang out after work. I will probably come here again to try one of their burgers and to enjoy the patio.

Sign at entrance directs you to seat yourself, sat down at a table and waited over 15 minutes without ever being served. Finally flagged down a waiter to at least bring us a menu. Another 10 minute wait with no service, and we gave up. Food may be good, but it does not count if you never get to eat it.

I had a bad experience at The Attic the first time I came. However, I've gone to burger night every Wednesday night for awhile now and I have been continually amazed by the quality of the burgers! It has become my favorite spot and it's by far the best burger I've ever had. The pretzel bun is exceptional and ranch is outta this world.

Went with a bunch of Yelp friends, had a great time.  Hamburger was great, nice beer selection.   Lively atmosphere despite being a Tuesday, it was really busy.  Can't beat the $10 burger + beer deal.  Easy 5 stars except that on this evening the service was slower than the 2nd coming of Jesus, I think there was 1 lady serving every table in the place.

It was late and our stomachs were growling but everything around us was already closed so we went here thinking that they would only be serving bar food at 10pm   (trying to eat healthy these days!) but ended up having the most delicious Greek salad with tons of veggies and homemade yogurt feta dressing!  Their fantastic beer selection changes daily and will send the beer connoisseur's tastebuds wild. My boyfriend got their award winning Ivan burger on a pretzel bun and licked his plate! We left with a smile and happy tummies. We will most definitely be back soon!! (& love that it's only a bike ride away from our house with a perfect open air patio!).

We came here for a Sunday Funday and had a great time! We sat out on the patio and enjoyed their large beer selection. We started with fried abaca do and a shrimp and cocktail sauce appetizer, both were delish! We all ordered burgers for the main course and they were all amazing! Will definitely be back!

When considering the generally "bro" like nature of most of the 'Phoenix hot spots,' The Attic is a breathe of fresh air when looking at their attention to fine craft beer and artisanal, gastro-style selections.

The Attic has the best burger in the greater Phoenix area that I've had.

Close in regards to other great burger spots in the area, but what set the Attic apart was a fine attention to detail in patty flavor, consistency, and freshness and less about adding flare to cover up a bland patty. It was juicy, buttery, meaty, and had the perfect consistency for a medium well patty.

The craft beer selection (unlike the other "craft beer bars" in the area) had balls and didn't focus on the general low ABV wheat beers with fruit added that Phoenix is known for.

Complete with bold selections from a triple IPA from Founders brewery and an Horchata Imperial stout from Elevation, the Attic has 21 taps filled with rarities and craft-tastic options. 

The Attic is a must if you enjoy great food and craft beer.

Go there immediately.

Ordered the hangover burger. Absolutely delicious. The pretzel bun really makes it. Great variety of craft beers . Very laid back place with great service. Very unpretentious . Next time you are in the Arcadia area , head over
I have to say, one of the best burgers EVER ... The Ivan cannot be missed and the beer selection awesome ... Met Steve and staff were all friendly and helpful

I'm sure the food is great as recommended by friends.  I sat myself as instructed by one of the waitstaff.  Took me 10 minutes of waiting before I asked for a menu.  Took another 15 minutes before I left.  No service for me.  I'm highly disappointed by the lack of service.

So my Aunt has been raving about the burgers here.  I like a good burger joint, though this place isn't technically a burger joint.  It has pizza, but its not a pizza spot.  The inside is like a sports bar, but its not really a sports bar.  It has a decent wine and craft brew selection, but its not really a brewpub.  So okay, this place is pretty much impossible to classify.  Which I assume is pretty much the idea.  For the record, I am aware of the social media snafu that occurred here months ago where the general manager viciously attacked an angry customer on social media for her poor review.  I guess the fact that this business is still standing must mean they took appropriate action to satisfy their patrons (or at least I hope so).  At any rate, my experience didn't have any drama, but did involve some good food.

Didn't do any appetizers here as I was told to come here for one reason.  The Ivan.  This burger was so hyped by my Aunt it was borderline ludicrous.  The specs:  a pretzel bun, huge juicy patty, tomato, your choice of cheese (I went cheddar), mixed greens, and chipotle mayo.  Fantastic burger.  The chipotle mayo and the pretzel bun absolutely make the difference.  Quality of the beef was excellent.  I got mine with a side salad, but you can get fries too.  For dessert we got the chocolate molten cake.  This was a disappointment.  The texture of the chocolate was fine, but the cake itself was rock hard.  It was edible, but not especially impressive.

The service we received was friendly throughout.  Our waitress got confused by a couple of the orders we put in, but quickly rectified the situation so no need to dock her too many brownie points for that.  Tonight they had discounts on their burgers so I saved $4 on the Ivan.  Total cost for tonights meal including the burger, side salad, a beer, and a chocolate cake, tax and tip was about $25.  I'd definitely come back to try some of the rest of their menu. A couple of tips, get here early as parking in the area is pretty limited.  Also, sit outside if the weather is right.  Its not as noisy and has a great view of the Arcadia neighborhood.  And take it from me, the Ivan lives up to the hype.

Believe the Wednesday burger night hype, honestly never been their any other day.  Great beer selection. Servers can seem stressed but do you see how many people go here on Wednesday I'd be wiggin out to.

This place was recommended  by a co worker because of the burgers.  Decent place and my guy and I decided to split a burger and ordered a MEDIUM cooked cheddar n bacon burger w/fries. At first burger came (cut in half for us to split) and it was clearly RARE!  Tons of pink (which the boyfriend cannot stand).  We explained to the waitress and she completely agrees and returns to the kitchen. After a short time the burger returns cooked WAY MORE to a medium however the fries sat while they took the burger, recooked and put BACK ON NOW SOGGY/BLOODY BUN! This burger plate we AGAIN return that and request a new bun and remotely warm fries. The waitress apologizes and agrees to make a new burger (very nice btw). So new burger comes promptly and.....PINK!!  Ugh! I was ok w/the pink this time but my (prefers hamburgers of 'leather' status) man was unhappy.  So after going through all this we finally ate .....and .....NOT anything to write home about.  The meat was decent but NOTHING i'd tell friends about.  If I'm gonna pay $13-14 bucks a burger it better taste above most else and this DID NOT. It was decent but so is some neighborhood bars for $8.  They did take 50% off our burger which was really cool I felt but....we most likely will not be back.
Great service and good food.  We had a burger, fries and wings.  Sean minor was yum.  The beer selection however was lacking.

Decent place. I like the location! Upstairs but very small. Only serve their beers and a few wines. No liquor or outside beers. We went with a large group and all tried a different burger, but the only one I remember what the Holmberge! It was delicious!! Saracha Candies Bacon and jalapeños.... Soooo good! A little heat and a little sweet! I'll be back for that burger but that's about it!

Cute spot and a nice happy hour. It's located above a restaurant and has a beautiful view from the seating on the patio. The bar opens up to the outside patio. I thought it was a nice balance of lounge and patio with a few TVs for those interested in watching a game. There's a gorgeous fireplace with a few outdoor sofas at the center of the patio. As for the food and drinks, they were good. I enjoyed the fish tacos. Service was great as well. They also have free valet  parking when you drive in. Nice touch.

We were completely ignored for 15 minutes. Multiple servers walked past us multiple times and never said a word. In fact, it was awkward watching them avoid eye contact with us. They only had about 6 tables of customers in there so it certainly wasn't due to the restaurant being slammed. The worst part is we got up and walked out past two servers and they didn't say a word...they could have cared less. There are far too many options in Biltmore/Arcadia to have that type of customer service. They ruined our night out and we would never return.

Cheyrl is wonderful!, pretzels are the bomb and a requirement you've never been here before.  If you happen to be lucky enough to stop by when the have deep fried artichokes on the app menu then you are lucky indeed!  Couch loungey by the fire place outside.  Excellent!

Went for the first time last night. If there were grown ups serving us (everyone that works here seems to still be in high school) I would have given them a five star. The beer selection is fantastic, my veggie sandwich was amazing. My friend said his burger was the best he's ever had. That's a BIG compliment. Since the service was not good, they only get 4 stars.

UPDATE: Am I the only one who gave this place a decent review (above) to get back the most crude, inappropriate message back from a "Jesse T"? Jesse: learn to speak English. 
The Attic: if this is one of your employees, you should kindly ask them to stop sending messages to yelp reviewers. They will single-handedly ruin your business.

Love this place. Consistently good service, food, and most importantly beer. They ALWAYS have new beers on tap. You can tell their chef really knows their stuff. The specials are solid and you can't miss with the regular menu. I'm so happy this place is within walking distance of my house.

I pretty sure I had a good time here.  I can't say I'm positive because of the beer I had.  Thankfully I took a picture of the menu so I know what beer to blame, or thank, for this night I no longer remember.  Shmaltz He'Brew Jew Reborn at an ABV% of 17.0.

I do remember really liking the table I had, a great view of the sunset and I had an awesome burger, the Ivan.  Once I made it halfway though the beer though the night fades away in my memory. 

I'll have to go back to verify I did like this place, and maybe take more notes or something while I try the Reborn again.

This was a pretty cool spot. We were riding around looking for a cool spot. We went in for a while. Decent spot with a patio. 

Mainly a beer and wine place. Tried one of the beers. It was cool. We only stayed for one drink. 

They had some TVs as well. Staff was pretty cool. He even recommended some other spots that had a full bar in the area.

If you like burgers, beer and fancy bar food... Service has always been great, beer menu is constantly rotating, we've never had to wait and theres always new food. Its a little on the pricier side, but I feel its appropriate given the quality. My only complaint is one time it was too loud, but other times we've been I didn't notice that so who knows. The place can be a challenge to find, just look for the iron gates and the fountain and then go up the stairs. I'd also love for there to be a couple more fruity/cider style beers.

My husband and I tried this place for dinner on Friday night. We loved it!!  The way it is on the second floor of this building is so unique to Phoenix, where everything is on the ground. The views of camelback mountain are beautiful. They have a new draft menu every night. I had the ginger cider which was good. We started with the arcadia attic wings. They were a little sweet with a spicy kick on the end.  Good but next time we will try the buffalo wings. My husband had The Ivan burger and I had the Hangover burger. Both on pretzel buns and chipotle mayo. The patties were juicy and cooked to perfection   And savory. But what set mine above his was the fried egg. Don't get me wrong, his burger was delicious but mine was DELICIOUS!!!!  We will definitely be back.

The atmosphere is awesome.  I like the decor and the set up, LOVE the patio - can't wait to put that to good use in the winter.  

The beer selection seems good, but the couple I tried wasn't impressive.

The burger was a bit greasy and light on the red onion (if the patty's so gigantic why would they just put a shaving of red onion on it??).  The santa fe dry rub wings were a little gross - too much chili powder? - the powder was just too much and not very good.  The chipotle ranch sauce that it comes with was good though and used it for my fries.  The flatbread pizza was too light on the red sauce.  The crust was decent.  

The service was SLOOOOOOOW.  

This is definitely more of a place to relax and drink than to eat.  The atmosphere and service says as much.  The food doesn't seem to be the focus at all.  Seems like maybe they should put a sign pointing to the front door or something too.
My wife and I love this place! The view is awesome. We try to go once a week. This past week we tried their fish tacos, they where amazing, and of course the Ivan and beer on Wednesday is the best.

Really cute vibe! It sits on the upper part of a building in Arcadia. Food was decent but the Santa Fe wings were very bland. My friends had a pizza and burger and said both were good. Great selection of beer. I'd probably give it another try and get something else.

My fiancée and I love coming here for burgers and their selection of beer/wine. We haven't tried the pizza yet, but we've heard good things about it! The service is also great. We brought our small dog the first time we came and they were very accommodating. Would definitely recommend!

I had high hopes for this place. Heard lots of people rave about it; unfortunately our experience was not as pleasant. I could over look the poor service if it was exceptional in other areas (ie- beer list, food). Our dry dusted Santa Fe wings were dry to the point of making us cough. Ok it says dry in the description so I can't complain but they lacked flavor. It was like they took spices from their mothers kitchen and just drenched them.DONT ORDER THEM! The meat platter was alright; decent at best. Artichoke salad.... Terrible. The only saving grace to this evening was the pizza, but we had to scarf it down to get home to our kids because our server never stopped by to take our order past the wings. We had to flag her down. All in all, I don't typically write bad reviews, but I felt that the 4 stars that this place holds reflects poorly on it's actual food, service and selection.

Went in to check out the place for the first time since I live in the area and hoped I could possibly make it a regular spot. As we walked it the staff was super unorganized and had to wait. After waiting a moment they asked if we were on the list and stated "not yet". The young guy walked away without placing us on a list and after several minutes he asked if we were ok and still didn't place us on a list or let us know how long the wait was. Too many good places to eat to put up with this type of attention. As we walked out they could care less about losing business. I refuse to give my money to a business that has zero customer service.

This is a joint review between my girlfriend and I. I gave it 4 stars she convinced me to give it 3... great beers, the rotation on beers is wonderful. This place has the BEST wings in Phoenix!!!! (Only the Arcadia attic Louisiana style).... was a fan of the Asian style wings (but they got rid of them as fast as their rotation of beers)... really like the scene but wish they focused more on prime time venues on tv's... every single tv is on the Kentucky Kansas game, would have liked to see the Baylor-ole miss game that came down to the wire.
Food and environment are cool but service is pretty slow. We went in on a slow Sunday night and waited over 30 mins for food with zero refills

My new favorite place. Had the Ivan and fries and also the bruchetta. Oh dear God it was all incredible. ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE. Our server Cheryl was wonderful too...very helpful and extremely funny. Love this place. I could go on and on but I just got home and about to go into a blissful Attic-fueled food coma. Ahhhhhhhhhh.......
I had a great experience today at the attic great location and the muscles in white wine were fab!!!!! I can guarantee 100% I will return!!
The food was good, but the service left a lot to be desired. No offer of water. The waiter walked by a half dozen times before dropping off a menu. Slow delivery of food. Not sure I'd go back.

Awful service and bartender not the nicest. Food is okay but service is so bad makes the food worse. Not a place I would go to often but the view is amazing so that makes it a 3 star. Nothing else nice to say so keeping it at that..

-When we arrived, the atmosphere was quite laid back.
-Decent selection of beers on tap
-Knowledgeable and friendly staff

We stopped in yesterday to grab a beer from their extensive list and a little snack.  The view of Camelback Mountain from their second story patio is beautiful.  The staff is friendly and the restaurant/bar has a laid back vibe to it.  We shared a pretzel and it was quite tasty...the mustard and spicy cheese were great for dipping too.  Looks like they have some great food specials to go along with their beer focused menu.

Not to bad, nice cozy area. Check out the video. Split the burger and pizza with friends. Burger was really good, the fries need some help. The seemed old and soggy. Pizza was good also, nothing to write home about. They could of used more staff, the server was sweet but had a lot of tables, I had to chase her for a couple of things. The view was cute, open patio. Would I go back, only if I am in the area.
Very nice service, facilities, location food and Drinks. Overall is a great experience! The bartender was ver attentive and talkative. I will recommend this anytime.  For food the burgersare amazing!
Really enjoyed the burgers & the selection of draught beers.  Noise level is definitely not "average" as Yelp states.  Actually really loud.  I would and will come back!  Well done Attic management.

I didn't know what to expect after reading the reviews but I have to say, I was very surprised. I went on a Saturday afternoon, around 4pm. I had a hard time actually locating the restaurant because it's not very noticeable (meaning they need a bigger sign). Anyways, you have to walk upstairs to get to the place but I didn't mind that at all. Me and my bf were greeted by two very polite men that were behind the counter and we were prompted to seat ourselves wherever we'd like. I love that :) anyways, we ordered the bruschetta and pretzel as an appetizer. The pretzel was good as well as those little cheeses and mustards that came with it. The bruschetta had a little too much tomato and Brie. The entrees we had were 'The Ivan Burger' and the Margherita pizza. Both were very delicious, the pizza was more than I expected..i definitely would come back just for it. Our waitress was very cute and nice and  knowledgable but I forgot her name. But this place is very cool and next time I come back I will try their patio. Did I mention that it has a fire place?? Yep I'll be back.

They always have great beers on tap as well as a nice bottle selection.  The Arcadia wings and burgers are excellent.  Wednesday night is their $10 burger and beer special night and I haven't been disappointed yet.

Burger night never disappoints! It's become family tradition to come on Wednesday nights for $10 beer and a burger. The wait is between 20-30 minutes during dinner hour (SO WORTH IT) but the staff/service/food is usually extremely quick and delicious. This week I tried their new SLC burger paired with a Founder's Devil Dancer triple IPA

One of my favorite burgers in town, aside from the obvious being that it's named after me (the Ivan Burger), it's actually a good burger! Staff is always pleasant and their ever-changing taps keep things interesting. We usually go Wednesday nights for their Burger + Beer special, which is only $12 or $14 depending on the beer you choose, and absolutely worth it. My only complaint would be that their burger isn't always cooked how I ask, it's either medium to well, or rare, and I love medium rare, but being that it's so delicious, you hardly even notice.

Lots of beers available. Several wines available as well. Good selections of both beer and wine to choose from. Burger and a beer for $10 every Wed. after 4pm. The burger is awesome, one of the best around as of late. Great deal. Nice patio overlooking Camelback Mtn. Live music on occasion.
This place is awesome! Go on Wednesdays for the Beer and Burger Special for $10

This is one of favorite happy hour haunts. Every day until 6:30. $1.50 off drafts, and they have a great craft selection, and half off appetizers, including wings. We had a pizza this visit and it was excellent! Thin crust with just the right amount of char on the edges. On top all that, you have friendly, efficient service, and great views of Camelback Mountain. Check it out.

The great thing about the attic is the consistency. Always great food, always a great beer selection, and very consistent friendly service. But mainly the beer selection!! Love love this place - here every week!

FYI, If you're into fantasy football, they have an Attic League which is free to play and is played on a game by game basis. In other words, the league plays just SNF for example then starts all over again for MNF and TNF. My point: if you play, you get special deals as a member of the Attic League (this week for example: $4 on any draft beer, $4 glass of wine, 1/2 off appetizers & 1/2 off growler fills). You just show the bartender your team on the leaderboard as proof. Plus there are prizes for game winners and weekly winners.
