Don't understand what all the fuss is about? They do have a great craft beer selection but almost everything is a 12oz pour ranging in price from $7 to $8.50 which is a bit pricey if you ask me! When we inquired about the wine about half of them weren't in stock. The fish tacos were good but nothing spectular and parking is flat out horribe. The major upside to this place was the sweet patio overlooking Indian School and the quick service. I would definitely trek the 1 mile to OHSO for a beer/ hangout if in the area again.

This is a cute place to come and start your Sunday Funday! 1/2 off bottles! The service was really good. We didn't get to try any of the food but it will be on the bucket list for next time. Love the ambience of this place. I hear great things about this place and I'm glad I finally came to try it.
Good craft beer selection and an excellent burger. I like the small outdoor second-story patio. They also show the games/fights on the handful of indoor and outdoor TVs.

Dear Chef: you should take the ceviche off from the specials or at least call it cucumber spicy slaw. That is NOT ceviche and that is NOT agua chile. Beer selection is good. Place is good. Food okay. I would give it 2 1/2 stars total.

My review might be slightly more helpful because I wasn't here on a Wednesday Night for the phenomenal Wednesday Special like almost everybody else was here for.

The menu is very limited and for the most part you are going to order a pizza or a burger and drink wine or one of the many craft brews they feature.

I can't say we had the best burgers out there anywhere because I haven't been everywhere but I can say we had some doozies of very good burgers priced less than Vegas and better than what we had in Las Vegas at one of those specialty burger places. 

Ivan Burger $12.00
Hangover Burger $14.00
Most craft brews run an average $8.00
VS. Las Vegas close to $20.00 a Burger

They only have a couple burgers to pick from on the menu and they can be altered slightly. I went with the famous Ivan burger. It is extremely large and is a half pound burger patty with the usual lettuce,tomato,onion, choice of cheese chipotle Mayo on a pretzel bun. It comes with tasty battered fries. My burger was cooked a perfect medium just like I asked for and had a nice crust. It was a very juicy burger but not too much as it didn't fall apart. The pretzel bun was strong enough to support all the weight of the sandwich fillings. It really was a tasty burger. 

I think at least half the people out there might think like me and admit the burger is too large. I split the burger in half because I knew that would be plenty. But would have enjoyed it more if it was smaller so it would be easier to manage. For me it was very thick and still delicious but too thick.

My husband tried the Hangover Burger. It's basically an Ivan Burger but with an added egg and he said really good bacon. I don't know how he ate that whole sandwich but he did and said he had to because it was really good.

The Attic is located above a sandwich shop and uses the name Cave and Ives on the outside of the building and on the receipts. The steps are easy to climb but if you are handicapped an elevator is available.

The burgers we had were VERY GOOD!
The Pizzas looked good!
Lots of craft beers.

I have to be honest. I typically like this place. Good burgers and good service, but one bad experience can out weight many others. Our most recent date night was definitely on my list of worst restaurant experiences. They got the order for our burger wrong and did not offer to correct it. Instead insisted on bringing another bun with no sauce or onion. Although annoyed we agreed but when our bill came we saw that they charged us for an "extra bun" . Well the other one was just thrown away so not sure what the extra charge was for. We had it removed before paying but I'll it was definitely not a good customer service experience.

The Attic is the new name for Cave & Ives. It's been taken over by new owner (who happens to be very familiar with Cave & Ives), but all the elements we loved about Cave & Ives are still intact. The official grand opening for The Attic is in August, but they are in fact open now!

We were so bummed when Cave & Ives closed in April. It was our favorite restaurant in the valley. We used to drive 40 minute to get there at least once a week. When we heard that Cave & Ives was reopening under a new concept and new name, we were hesitant to go back. We didn't want to ruin the fond memories we had of Cave & Ives. Now we kick ourselves and say, "Why have we not been back sooner!"

As soon as we walk through the door, we were greeted with familiar faces and some very pleasant surprises. Ryan, the bartender that we loved for his great service and beer knowledge, was still there. In fact, they added more taps and now serve even more varieties of beers than before. They no longer have the large selection of bottled beers, but their draft beer selection was, and is still, very impressive. If you don't know what to drink, ask Ryan. He will not steer you wrong. In fact, we often choose to sit at the bar because Ryan is there. 

We were ecstatic to see that the menu hasn't changed too much either. The burger is still being served and all the pizzas are still the same. If you go to The Attic for the first time, YOU MUST ORDER THE BURGER!!! Ryan just informed us tonight that their burger was named one of the top 10 burgers in the United States! The Burger is a grill 1/2 lb. patty topped with grilled onions, chipotle mayo, spring greens, on a pretzel bun with your choice of cheese, and a side of French fries. If you can, order the bacon, sautéed mushrooms, and blue cheese.  You can also order The Hangover Burger, which is the burger with a fried egg and bacon strips. If you're into spice, ask the server for Da Bomb. They keep it behind the bar. Our second favorite item on the menu (by a very close second) is the steak salad. They didn't have it this time, but Ryan assures us that the steak salad will also be coming back soon.

We were so happy that the experience of going to The Attic has not diminished our memories of Cave & Ives. The new décor with darker walls and pops colorful art is a plus. The music choices and more relaxed atmosphere made the place better. We also discovered that they added a burger challenge to the menu. Each challenger will need to each more than the last challenger (1 more patty, 1 more egg, 2 more strips of bacon). The winner gets to rename the burger and get their picture up on the wall. My husband is psyching himself up to doing the challenge on Tuesday! 

The Attic might be a different name, but same location, great service, delicious food, and excellent beer selection.

I LOVE THE ATTIC!!!

Seriously, this place has one of the best burgers in Arcadia. The Ivan is a classic - tasty and juicy. I always get the avocado for the extra "yum" factor. The Hangover is also amazing. It has saved me many Saturday mornings! The egg and bacon is cooked to perfection.

You may think the food is my favorite part of the Attic Ale House. Wrong! You need to see this beer list to believe it. They have all the local favorites, but also rotating crafts from all over the country. The list changes daily and there is always something for everyone.

I will definitely be back. The patio is too good to resist!
This is a wonderfully located spot. I ordered the Ivan and am looking forward to it, but I really can't wait until I get a chance to experience that patio!!

Wowzers, now this is an awesome gastropub. No ifs ands or buts about it, they have probably the best burger I have ever tasted here, ready for your enjoyment...

~Fud/Drink~
"The Burger", as they call it on their menu, is one of the best burgers in the world...its ranked. Yep, I know. I am not a big burger person, especially in the latter part of my young life. I am much more content with a fish or chicken dish than a greasy burger. But I must say I will gladly cross the line drawn in the sand for this burger. Upon picking up an already half eaten burger, I immediately noticed the weight and density. I was floored. It is impressively heavy, packed with yummy mixed greens, shaved red onion and the choice cheese tonight being provolone. The chipotle mayo is sublime, mixing the beef together along with the pretzel bun. Overall, this definitely constitutes the afformentioned ranking...its damn good.

Plus we enjoyed the burger and beer $10 special which they offer Wednesdays. The entire tab including my lone beer I ordered on the side would have come out to over $28, however the special shaved off $2 from the burger and an additional $6+  on our bill....IMPRESSIVE! This deal is on par with other nightly specials in the area... I fail to mention the fact that the beer selection is very good, they offer enough lighter varieties for me to try, but they offer something for every beer drinker.

~Atmosphere/Service~
Inside it may seem a bit cramped, but its not...the layout is quaint and you are surrounded by fun sings and album covers of indy bands. They have a few TV's with sports on, and the patio also provides a couple TV's as well. It is darker inside than a normal food spot, which lends to The Attics trademark chill vibe. Waitress was average in speed of service, nothing to write home about. I had no real questions to ask...next time I will pick their brains more. Awesome hangout bar, really relaxed atmosphere, once again.

~Extras/Rating~
Wednesday...$10...Beer....Burger....Special... JUST DO IT!

They get 5 stars. Why? Well, they have an amazing selection of crafts, an intimate setting and atmosphere, insanely tasty food, and heck, the best burger-beer deal in town..I mean, its the best burger and some of the best beer...IN TOWN, lol! Its a no-brainer. Bank it! Shoo-wop!

Five stars for the Thursday pizza special. 
Went in last night and was only planning on a beer but was then introduced to the daily special : 
Any glass of wine or beer with any pizza for $12. 
Considering specialty beers can range from $5-$9 and pizzas from around $10-$16 this deal doesn't get any better! 
I'm now won over for Wednesdays AND Thursdays! Be back soon!

We wandered in here after a night at the Wandering Tortoise & absolutely loved it here! Everyone enjoyed their drinks, they provide blankets to keep you warm on the patio & the food was bomb. My husband has been searching for a place with great wings & he feels confident he's found it here! He ordered the Santa Fe dry rub & Louisiana Style BBQ & he loved them both. I ordered the Margherita Pizza & it's one of the best I've ever had. My other favorite Margherita pizza place is LGO & I still like their sourdough crust the best, but the toppings on the pizza here blow LGO out of the water in my opinion. Everything was super fresh & flavorful. We will definitely be back!

Complimentary valet makes parking easy, walk up stairs to a fun design looking towards camelback mountain. They have a good happy hour so take advantage and a large selection of great beer that I didn't expect. Ordered a meat plate and it was so-so. A little boring but a good deal for 11$. Saw a guy go after their big challenge burger, something like 7 .5pound parties and a ton of bacon and cheese and fixins. It was impressive for only 50$. Not sure he finished it.

Cool little hideaway.  The room is shaped like a long rectangle and it's situated upstairs in a two-story building.  It's not too big to make you feel lost nor too small to make you feel like you're suffocating.  Upon entering, you immediately feel like you've entered a hideout...maybe that's just me.  The place just feels like it's tucked away in a wide open space. It's different. Their patio has a fireplace and it feels quaint.  Sheryl, the waitress, makes eating there feel like you're at your friend's kitchen table.  If you are not big on burgers, like me, they have their pizzas.  The appetizer menu is limited. But oh the beer list is worth going there just for that.
Food and service fresh and tasty. Great to place to watch the game and view of camelback mountain.
I've gone here on 2 separate occasions and absolutely love their food. Last time I tried the burger called The Farm and have to say that it's probably the best I have ever had.

Really cool looking place. I enjoyed the various beer pulls hanging along the wall and the outdoor seating it's classy with a fireplace and has an incredible view of Camelsback mountain.  However, that was the extent of this experience. 

I had the "Hangover" burger and the "Santa Fe" wings. The burger I enjoyed the bun and although the burger was decent, I've definitely have had better and their fries are served well done, brown? For $14 and this highly reviewed/recommended place, I was expecting a WOW for my tastebuds, but that didn't happen.  The wings were on HH special six for only $3, great deal and I did like the wings to have them again.

I'm wondering if during our visit with a party of 4 and other customers filling in, more servers would be ideal. It was took a long time for service including not getting any refills of water or other beverages, food came out slowly and my burger didn't come out with the other couple with us. Our waitress said , "we don't know what happened, it was put on the ticket and entered into the computer, but didn't come up? No apology but said we're making it right now." Okay, no biggie.  We were enjoying our company and stay.  I ended up getting refills for our table of waters and sodas for myself and my friend at the bar next to our table. I didn't think anything was wrong with this, since I thought I was helping out our waitress since she hadn't come around and we were out of drinks throughout our stay, but the second time I did this our waitress was clearly not happy I did this and made a comment directly at me on what I was doing, I answered I'm getting us our refills and smiled. Talk about Awkward. 

Should I give our service the benefit of the doubt? I don't know, I might try them out again socially with friends but I know there's a lot of other places to try and recently many of us dined elsewhere and the burger quality of the beef was great. Enjoy.

The Attic Ale House is great. The food is good. The beers are good. The service is great. Everyone that works there is awesome. They have a great Happy Hour. And their burger special on Wednesday and Pizza special on Thursday are a must go to event. The view from the patio is the best in Arcadia. See attached photo. My only complaints are 2. One...I get the awesome rotating beer selections but have a few popular staples that never change. Sucks to find a favorite and it's gone next time you visit. Two...don't let "friends" hang out and dominate the scene every damn day. Allow good paying guests to enjoy the atmosphere without your "buddies" bringing in outside beer and homemade lemonchello to show off. Save that for private. This is a business first. That s@$& will bring down a business. Trust me. I've seen it happen. An episode of Bar Rescue was devoted to it. Otherwise good place.

Place sucks. Horrible service. Waited 45 minutes for six - yes, six - wings. Bartender was openly drunk, loudly cursing. Food not worth the price or wait. Can't believe people giving this place 5 stars. Get out more. Such a bad experience I signed up with Yelp to leave this review. Avoid at all costs.

This place has the best burger ever, wings are awesome, and an amazing selection beers.

One of my favorite spots in phoenix.

This place was recommended to me by a friend, I had never been but have always wanted to go, I had driven by 100 times and seen a ton of people on the outdoor patio and I love a good burger, and this place supposedly has one of the best in the country..."The Ivan" $13.00...to say the least I was not impressed. I have had better burgers at pretty much every other place around here, OHSO, Delux, Christ even the Chicago hamburger company down the streets sliders tasted better as far as I am concerned. Myself and my gf came on a Sunday afternoon, as I was walking up the stairs I stepped in a huge piece of fresh gum, obviously some uncultured swine that had just frequented the place must of spit this out, to say the least it was pretty gross, it took a minute to scrape off the bottom of my shoe, and was not the best start to my experience...we walked in and the bar was moderately busy... and all the tables were taken, I am not sure if there is suppose to be a hostess, there was no one around so we decided to seat our selves on the patio, to what seemed to be dismay of our server. She was horrible. Dulce. Poor attitude and not very friendly. Had to get up to ask for drink refills, also seemed like there was a huge issue with asking to turn the misters on outside, they turned them on and then a few minutes later turned them off, where I had to ask to turn them back on again it was just over 100 outside.  It took forever for our food to come out. On appearance alone the Ivan which probably stands close to 6 inches high looks pretty impressive, but taste wise...I was really not impressed. My Gf had the same thing...she too was not impressed, and she did not finish hers. The fries were mediocre...and as I said in general so was this experience here. Probably will never go back.
Very interesting place.  Patio and inside seating transition through open space.  Nice craft beer list.  Bruscetta was excellent and the Ivan..... oh the Ivan.  I would be back for that alone.

The best burger in Phoenix! Try the Ivan, it's a big Sandwich though! So my friends who can't eat much, I advised them to eat half and take the other half to go, it comes on a pretzel bun and fries! Wings are super good too ;) great beer on tap, great atmosphere and amazing services!

Good view, friendly servers. But food and service was just ok at best. We asked for ranch with the burger but it came out after we were finished and with a bug in it (no apologies). Also they were terrible at refilling drinks. Skip the pretzels, but the wings are good. This place has great potential but the dining experience left us super disappointed. Despite going during happy hour and splitting two apps and one entree, our bill was still $40 total so not a great value (we didn't get any beers either).

Tonight was my second time coming to the Attic Ale House and I must say they have one gosh dang good burger. The Ivan burger is super simple but their beef is very flavorful and they cook it just right so it's nice and juicy! Pretzel bun is really good too! Their hot wings are also really flavorful too, a lot of meat and a good buffalo sauce. They have an extensive list of draft beers too. This is a really cool place to come and check out when in the Arcadia area.

I have driven by this place in the evening. The Attic is kind of a cool comfortable looking place from street level. (Indian School Road). 
There are plenty of great places to hang out at in that neighborhood. I expected this place to be on par with the rest of them.
I was not happy with my experience there. I couldn't tell the help from the customers.
No one was in any kind of uniform at all..
The crowd seemed very college like (young and immature) the staff seemed the same way.
Great for a very very young crowd, but not my cup of Vodka martini.
You can keep this place.
The food was not worth the money either, I tossed half of it in the trash when the busboy came by to collect our plates.
I will not be going back to this place unless they bring it up several notches.

I went here last night and it was a nice little spot to go to. I will definitely be going again. I had a few slices of their Two Brothers Pepperoni pizza. The pepperoni on the pizza were nice and crisp and had good flavor to them. The cheese wasn't bad. The edges of the pizza were nice and crisp which I liked, however where this dish fell short was the crust. Aside from the crust edges, the crust was doughy, soft, limp and had no texture that it should have because that's the point of the pizza crust. I wouldn't order pizza from here again. I then had half of The famous Ivan burger. On the menu it stated the Ivan was one of the top 5 burgers in the world. I beg to differ. The Ivan has to be the best burger on this planet! The meat was juicy and flavor exploded in your mouth with each bite of just the meat by itself, not to mention the amazing fixings they put on the burger, and the bun was phenomenal. I would have given two stars based off of the pizza but I had to bump my review up to 4 stars after that burger.
Nice place to hang out especially to sit outside on the balcony.  Beer selection is great. Great food menu selection. We had the burger and mac and cheese.  The mac and cheese portion is very large.
Ivan burger and a beer for 10 bucks on a Wednesday feels like stealing... Its amazing!

Wrote a bad review previously, but went a few more times, this place definetly improved a lot =)

The wait time is still excessive, went back last week even and like I expected it always took like 30 to 45 minutes to pay for my meal, it's always been like that though so you kinda have to expect to spend a lot of time here when you come.

The food is delicious and so is the selection of beer sooooo I guess it's all kinda worth it.

This is not a 4 or 5 star restaurant.  Four of us went tonight for $10 burger and beer special.  I had been once when it was Caves and Ives and the elements that contributed to its demise are still present: super-loud atmosphere and staffing that is not adequate to give top-notch service.  For a restaurant that was supposed to be out of business, they should take the name off of the side of the building, and don't run the credit cards with the old name on the receipt.

So the good things: 21 beers on tap with a good national selection; as a supporter of locally-crafted beer, I wish they would feature some of the excellent AZ beer being made.  The burger was huge and would easily feed 2 pretty hungry people.  But my medium-well burger was cooked more than the other burgers that were ordered medium, and the "no mayo" part of the order was missed on one.

As near as I could tell, there were only 2 waitresses and the bartender (no hostess) waiting on the whole restaurant. And they were literally running back and forth, so while I appreciate their efforts, it's poor form for a well-run restaurant. 

The noise level was truly deafening and the vibrations from the air handler on the other side of the wall next to our table were bad enough that I will not be visiting again, but if you don't care about communicating with the folks across the table, go enjoy a potentially great burger and a beer for only $10 on Wednesday night.

Went back for happy hour only to find it not open until 4, big disappointment.  I couldn't tell because there were people drinking in there and it was apparently bring your own on the patio, a six pack of Heineken was the special of the day. Place was dirty and unfriendly, won't be going back, to many other places to go. That's too bad because the Holmburger was really good! What a Sh*thole this place has turned into!

My wife and I wanted to try something different, so after a Google search of best burgers in Phoenix, this place showed up. They do not appear to have a website.
We thought we'd give it a try and our first problem was parking. It's 'complimentary' valet, unless you want to park on the opposite side of Indian School and Jay-walk across traffic. I didn't have any cash on me, so this put me immediately in an awkward position. I asked the valet if there were any ATMs inside and he recommended I download an app for my smartphone to pay him. I explained that my wife and I both have flip phones, so app downloading is not an option. He suggested I ask for some cash back at the end of my meal. I told him I would try it.

Next, we went up the stairs that leads to a tinted glass door with no writing on it. Would it kill them to stencil THE ATTIC on the door? We could see the restaurant through the windows alongside the top, but we were not certain the 'blank' door led to the entrance of it or some other business that might be upstairs. We walked back down the stairs and a bit further along the building only to realize those are the ONLY stairs, so back up the stairs we went for the second time.

When we walked in, a sign said to seat yourself and I could not find any employees anywhere. So we grabbed a table. Outside looked nice, but not when it's 110 degrees outside! Soon after we were greeted by a young man who poured us some water and said our waitress would be with us soon. That's when I realized the employees apparently wear whatever they want, t-shirts, polo shirts, pants, shorts, etc... This makes them completely indistinguishable from the guests!

While waiting, I counted 6 flat screen TVs showing football, grey paint on the walls, and the noise. Yes, it gets very loud in there in such a narrow, long space with people talking. I SAID IT GETS REALLY LOUD IN THERE AND MAKES IT HARD TO TALK TO THE PERSON YOU'RE DINING WITH ACROSS THE TABLE!

It's clear many of the guests dining here really love it, so the whole place has this great energy to it. Still, a $12 burger? A $14 burger? That's a lot of money for just a burger. Everything I read online and at Phoenix New Times was that their IvanBurger was to die for. My wife ordered it without the bun (lettuce wrap instead). Its a pretzel bun, which I think is a poor choice. They were also offering potato skins for $6, but you only got two. Two potato skins? Who does that? Most places bring you an app plate with 6-8 skins for the same price. So I didn't order that. Instead, I thought I would try the cheese pizza, since I read their pizza was good, too.

As we placed our order with our waitress, I asked if they had Coke or Pepsi? She said they had RC cola. Whoa! RC cola? Kalil drinks, like they serve at Arby's? Yes. So I ordered a beer instead. I'm not much of a beer drinker, but I ordered the Hawaiian 'Maul' which was a pretty good beer, but again, I'd be happy with a Bud Light - I'm just not into beer.

 My wife order The Ivan with small salad ($12) and my cheese pizza ($10) and beer ($5.50) and just water for the wife. The Cave & Ives total was $27.50 +  $2.29 tax.

The pizza was cooked perfectly on the top, and barely at all on the bottom. The dough and cheese were very fresh, but the sauce tasted like its main ingredient was sugar. That's fine if you're dining at Peter Piper or Chuck E Cheese, but I expected something more 'adult.'

And that, therein, is my problem with this place. I think if I was in my 20's or 30's I'd want to dine at a hipster place that's hard to find the entrance, see my peers working without any uniform and watch the game while drinking microbrews. But at 47 years old, I can't and do not want to eat a burger that's over 10" tall, with bacon and cheese and a pretzel bun. I just want a good burger on a whole wheat bun without the cheese or the bacon. Let the meat speak for itself rather than drown it with all the condiments. A restaurant called Charr offers it numerous ways, to serve all kinds of customers. I don't think most people over the age of 45 are in the demographic of who The Attic is trying to appeal to.

With all the condiments pushed to the side of her plate, my wife ate her lettuce-wrap burger and was very pleased with how it tasted and she was very pleased with the location and the atmosphere and the prices. Overall, though, she'd like to try coming back when the whether is cooler and we can sit out on the balcony and try some different menu items. The pretzel sounds amazing, but I was afraid if I ordered it, I would have no room left for dinner. Maybe next time.

Every one of the staff were very friendly. The menu is EXTREMELY limited and the prices are, in my opinion, about $4 too high for the burgers.

I explained the valet situation and the waitress did permit me to add an extra $2 to her tip, and she gave me that $2 cash back, which I then handed to the valet (also very courteous and professional) as they retrieved our car.

Went on a Tuesday with one of my friends, she got the pizza and I got the trio tacos, the shrimp, fish and chicken. Not to bad at all, really good and filled me up, pizza was super good, and wine was 1/2 off Tuesday's and the tacos were $3 each and special was $2 off so $7 I was full
Oh and the sweet stout was the best!! So damn Good!! Our waiter, he was super cool and informative!! 
They have a hamburger challenge there, if you finish your 7patties and 7 slices of cheese, along with pickles, without going to the bathroom, or spewing it out, it's yours free and you get to name your own burger and this burger is $50 smackaroos!! Good luck!!

Best. Burger. Of 2013... And to top it off, I was there for their Wednesday $10 burger & beer special.  What a pleasant surprise.  You know, we eat every day.  And most days we really don't think twice about it.  But on this day, repeatedly, I had to set the burger down, and just let my taste buds thank me for such a glorious meal.  The fries, in my humble Idahoan opinion, were cut fresh and seasoned perfectly, the patty was the perfect size and the pretzel bun was maybe the best I've ever had.

Add to that a couple pints of my first Jewish IPA (HeBrew Hop Manna IPA - it was Hasiderific!) and I was completely content.  This was my 1st venture to this area of Phoenix, and I found out there's a bar across the street called The Little Woody?  Sold.  I will be back, and it will most certainly be on a Wednesday!

Great food, great beer choices, and a great atmosphere. 

The view on this place is killer and I absolutely love sitting out on the patio when it is cooler out. I have had the pizza here, the hangover burger, the pretzel, and the wings and they have all been spectacular. For my beer drinkers, you'll love the selections on the list and they are so much more than your different pale ale options, they have some really interesting beers on tap! I had a plum beer and a chocolate stout beer and both were outstanding.

Katie should be your go-to if you want good service and a chick with knowledge on brews. My friend also asked her for a "smooth" wine and Katie hooked her up with one and she loved it. 

I'd suggest to take full advantage of the patio if the weather permits and enjoy the view. This place is great!
There is nothing that can be said about this place that hasn't already been said. Great food, great beer, and great customer service. Burgers are the best in town hands down.

Half a star for the food. 4 stars for the beers. The patio is nice and offers a nice view but honestly I will never eat there again. We left all of our dishes half full. I would grab a beer there though because they have some rare stuff usually on tap. Went there during football season and was watching a game and cheering for my squad but the bartender and his boys were talking so much crap about my team that it wasn't even worth responding to. Paid my tab and left their nasty half eaten food on the table. Ice Cold wings? Nah, I'm good.

The beer selection is good. The food looked good, but I just had a beer. Play some music! It's annoying having to listen to all the drunk loud old ladys cackle. At least drown them out with background noise. And I waited a real long time to get a beer, even though there is plenty of staff available. They all stand around and hang out and walk around wondering.

I've been wanting to try this place since it was Cave and Ives and I FINALLY made it there the other night. I REALLY enjoyed the place. It's got a REALLY great atmosphere with a nice patio and a fun, cheerful crowd.  They have a good selection of craft beers on tap, as well as wine and cocktails. I had their Ivan burger which was delicious, but HUGE.

Beyond that, I had downed beers the rest of the night and had a good time. I must say that I wasn't overly crazy about the service. The bartender while reasonably efficient and polite wasn't the warmest or friendliest. It was pretty busy so I definitely take that into account but her attitude was noticeably contrary to the overall warmth and cheer of the place and the patrons which was disappointing.

I am still down to come again because this is a fun place and I highly recommend it.
The best burger I have ever had.  Period.  The only negative thing was the person behind the bar changed the station when the song  "It Wasn't Me" came on.  lol  Love that song!!!!!

Quaint, friendly, yummy, simple, fabulous. I had a frosty glass of the Blueberry Pale Ale and a (Yum) Hangover Burger with a side salad (some yogurt dressing on top). And the view......uh, the view is 'awesome'. If you like a good craft brew and a crazy good burger this is the place for you!

My husband has had this joint on his "must check out" list for a while, so we made a Wednesday evening drop in. I don't think we could've picked a better night because every Wednesday is host to the Ivan burger special! Lucky patrons will get one Ivan burger and one craft draft for 10 bucks. Yes, you read that right friends.
Maybe you'd be more impressed if you knew just how delicious that Ivan burger is, on a pretzel bun with all of the right fixings and chipotle mayo for a little kick. It truly earns it's distinction as one of the top five all-time burgers (so sayeth the menu).
And when I say craft draft, I mean it! These guys have a great and varied rotating selection. And if you want something outside of what they currently have tapped and perhaps something more difficult to come by, feel free to buy a bottle or two from the coolers up front to try with that burger instead.
Overall great food and great service at the bar. Definitely prepare yourself for a wait if you are into eating earlier. This place is a bit small and is busy as a happening happy hour spot. I'll be back again in the fall (if not sooner) to take in a brew and the view when the outdoor patio space is once again open.

If you like craft beer and better than average bar food then this place is perfect!

It's on the second level of the building and you can see Camelback Mountain from the bar and front patio.

The service is great and all the employees really know about craft beer.  I had a Racer X IPA that I had never tried before and it was wonderful.  I also had a rich and creamy Avery Czar Imperial Stout that was awesome.

The Ivan burger is as good as the hype.  They also double fry their french fries to make them extra crispy the way I like them!

The Attic really does a great job and I can't wait to come back soon.

Was heading towards another restaurant when this place caught our eye. We decided to check it out, and I'm so glad we did! The rooftop made for the perfect bar vibe. My friend and I shared the Hangover burger and OMG it was delicious. Paired with a couple of beers and we had ourselves a great Sunday lunch. Definitely will go back!

Love this place great patio and inside seating. Always great food and service. Recently had a birthday dinner there. I first made reservations for 8 but ended up being 12 they had no problem accommodating our party. I do have to say one of the best burgers in town not to mention great selection in beers too! I am so glad I stumbled on this outstanding place.

Incredible! If you love burgers and beer this is the place for you! 

I tried the Holmburger medium rare...juicy and full of  jalapenos and siracha pancetta that brought the flavor up a notch!

Along with that I had the Strawberry Milk Jug Porter
...very tasty!

Cheryl our server was friendly, spunky and super-accommodating...such a terrific gal!
Hours on the yelp site say they are open on Sundays, drove all the way there just to see its closed. I'm pissed
My burger was fantastic and the beer was better!! I went with the waitresses suggestion and really enjoyed the beer! Great ambiance , love all the taps hanging on the walls.
I really like this place. The grass fed burgers are excellent. Great beer list. Wait staff very friendly. Nice view of mountains from bar. Very nice patio

The Attic has really great burgers; their happy hour is awesome, and I really love eating their fries with the chipotle mayo they have! I actually get sad if I'm in Phoenix and forget to eat here. One of my favorites for sure!

One time we got there and there was a waiting list (written on a chalkboard), after putting our name at the bottom and a few people were seated, some guy walks in and writes his name down at the top thinking he's outsmarted the system and will be seated with his friends who have yet to show up before everyone else. I politely mentioned it to the hostess, and she told me she saw him do that in the past. I told her where his name should have been placed given the 10+ groups that were actually before him; and she kindly noted it. Really lovely hostess, she's been great many times in the past as well; shes one of those people that actually cares about her job.

Either way, great establishment, and I will certainly visit and recommend to others!

I'm a huge burger fan.  After hearing these guys had one of the top 5 burgers in the country, I had to give it a try.  Really a fantastic experience...and absolutely the BEST burger I've ever had.  The pretzel bun is just great.  Most places with a good burger use the bun as the thing to hold the meat; The Attic's pretzel bun is so delicious you could eat it by itself.

We went on a Wednesday and I got to try a rare Sierra Nevada firkin IPA...just delicious.  Great craft beer selection, excellent food.  You might have to wait, but--trust me--it's worth it.

We went there for lunch and split the Ivan Burger and the Bruschetta. Both dishes were solid. The burger was cooked median rare as ordered and was very tasty. I really enjoyed the Bruschetta maybe more that the burger since it has Brie cheese on it along with a pesto aioli and a distinct sweat/slightly spicy additional aioli. Service was friendly and attentive. Great spot on a beautiful day.

So glad I found this place! A few of us stopped in for some drinks and food after a nearby yelp event. The restaurant is located upstairs on the 2nd floor and has both inside and outdoor seating. The outside patio is big with an outside bar, tvs, couches and tables. Some of the seating is right on edge so you can overlook from the balcony which is really cool. 

The staff was awesome!!!! We had a lot of fun talking with them and the service was great.

We sat outside in one of the lounge couches and relaxed while enjoying some wine and appetizers. We ordered the bruschetta, caprese, dry rub wings, and pretzel. All of it was super good and filling between the 3 of us. The bruschetta was desert like and delicious. I also loved the pretzel dipped in the cheese sauce.

Overall everything was super good and I'm looking forward to coming back! I highly recommend. Would be a great place for happy hour or to watch a sports game!
Burger Wednesdays are the best! They have great burgers and cold beer. Their staff are very friendly and on it! Plus a mountain view. What's not to like?!

I went here for the first time this week. Jeff wanted to check it out for a possible Sunday UYE meet up. He knows how much I love burgers so he took me on Wednesday for the burger and a beer special. I was almost going to stay home because I was exhausted but I am glad I went. It is a small space but cute at the same time. While I was looking at the menu I saw that their burgers were in the top10 in the world. That got me excited to try it. The beer selection was very different because they were beers that are not as popular to the area but I found one that was really good.
Then... my burger came out. Holy cow, literally! It came out in a pretzel bun with fries. I had to strategize how I was going to eat it because it was so big. Once I took my first bite, I was in heaven. Burgers are one of my favorites so you can imagine that I was enjoying every bite. It just melted in my mouth. I am making my mouth water right now just writing about it. Anyway, great place and I will definitely be back.

What a great little nugget in PHX.  I had the happy hour special: burger and a beer for $10.00.  Premium ingredients and who doesn't love a good pretzel bun?  The french fries were really extra crunchy.  I'm not sure which beer I had, I just asked for a light on tap but I really liked it.  Great little patio outside, will definitely be back for more!
This place has a friendly crowd of craft beer drinkers and a great rotating selection of craft brew.  The burgers are great too.

Stopped in for lunch on Sunday afternoon. The beer selection was pretty good and the burgers were great. I had a the Holmberg which was excellent. The burger featured a 1/2 lb patty with Jalapenos, Sriracha and pancetta. There was really nice sweet sauce too. The Burger was a little messy but it was good. The view of camelback mountain while watching some football was nice too. The wait staff was quick and helpful. I will definitely be back again.

Meet up with some fellow yelpers for a HH UYE, the place picked was the Attic. What a fun little place this is.

We meet up on a Wed night, mostly because they have a wed night special of a burger & beer for 10 bucks! Man that's a great deal! 

I'm not really a beer drinker, but overheard a fellow Yelper say that Stouts are like a coffee base/flavored, I like coffee, so this might work, I saw the #6 was a Bells Cherry Stout, and that's the one I picked.  I enjoyed the stout, it didn't taste the same as a normal beer and it has a heavy body to it. I liked it. It went well with my burger too.

The burger in this beer & burger deal for 10 bucks is the Ivan. Let me tell you, Ivan is beefy, juicy and messy, just the way I like it.  It's on a pretzel bun, has lettuce, tomato, chipotle mayo, cheese and bacon if you like. I ordered mine medium rare, and it was oooohhhhh ssssooooo goooood!! 

The only downside for this evening was the fries, this was my 3rd stop for a burger in a just a matter of a couple of weeks and I again run into SHOESTRING FRIES!!! Come on PHOENIX, these are not real fries!! But these were worst then shoestrings; they were the mini shoestring, the half pints of the crew!! Now I am an Irish girl and love me some spuds, so you betcha those half pint mini shoestring fries were eaten up!

Other than the shoestring fries, everything else was a perfect, The Attic is a great find and I look forward to coming back.

Still by far my favorite burger spot hands down.

But be warned, make sure you check your tab before you leave. My boyfriend and I had come in with a couple of our close friends to show them how truly amazing these burgers are.  3 of us had ordered the special burger of the night "da bears" which I wish they would keep on the menu. But anyways when we all had ordered the beer that you could get without getting charged extr (they have little peppermint patties) next to them I feel like is a waste of ink on their menus since the waitress charged us full price for the beers and just subtracted 3 dollars from each when we did not order the other beers on purpose because we wanted the 12-14 dollar deal that comes with a burger and beer for the above listed price that you are told won't change if you get the appropriate (peppermint patty dotted) beers. 

With that being said I'm not sure how often my boyfriend and I will be back since we are not a huge fan of places changing their prices and not being a good deal. I guess good things can never last right?

This place used to be called Cave & Ives, which is very missed! The gentleman who owned it previously did however make a wise choice to sell it to another gentleman who knows restaurant biz as well. The Attic is a very delicious burger joint. They have the world's famous burgers and were appointed as one of the top burger joints in the United States. Which to my liking, they were excellent. You have to definitely try this place if you are a burger girl like me!

Stopped in for lunch here.  Sat outside at the bar overlooking the mountain. Super cool spot.

Our server was great and really accommodating. We had one of their burgers and split it cuz it was huge. I wanted spicy; he didn't, so I ordered the chipotle mayo and sriracha pancetta on the side. No problems there. A great burger done perfectly (ordered medium for medium rare-ish) The bun was a pretzel bun, fresh and tasty and kept together well on the enormous burger with fixins. 

The boys had the Holmburgers and wings and loved them too!  All went really well with the Dragoon Stronghold pints.
Absolutely love this place. They make their own gluten free pizza dough. Best that I have ever had! I will keep coming back!

Fantastic selection of craft beers, on draft as, as well as an impressive collection of specialty bottles! Ryan, their beer pro, is knowledgable, and remembers what we typically like to drink, so recommendations are on point, and always let's us try new beers! Can't complain about the view of Camelback either. They offer events weekly, such as special tappings/brewery events/dinners... so always something interesting to taste. A couple TVs if you're looking to watch a game. Good vibe, wether you'd like to socialize with your own friends and not be bothered, or meet new people. Highlights for me include the burgers (and I'm not even a big burger fan), and the bruschetta (amazing unique sauce). Unique space on a second story, great view, good food, awesome specialty beer selection, friendly perople who remember your name (or at least your drink)...what's not to like?

I love the attic for their fish tacos! I have no idea what they put in them but they are seriously addicting I had 4 of them and a spinach salad one time and they seriously had to cut me off! The spinach salad there is amazing too! It is a must try along with all the beers simply delicious and a great way to enjoy inside or outside.

So I have been itching to go here for awhile and now can't wait to go back when's cooler so we can enjoy the awesome patio. We went on Father's Day for the special and were not disappointed. The food was exceptional and the beer selection was unique. Small place but with the room they have it's utilized very well and it is very unique inside. Very much recommend this place.

This place is amazing!! The hamburgers were so spectacular you can eat them alone and be filled up. The choice of beer was overwhelming but I was able to settle for watermelon flavored beer that went great with the burger. The outdoor ambiance made the great date with my husband well worth the money spent!

Came here for the first time last Thursday.  The place is a little hard to find but that's not a big deal to me.  The meat and cheese plate was amazing.  My friend and I also split a burger with fries and a pizza.  She has a hollow leg, I swear.  Anyway, the food was great and everyone was really friendly.  Aside from the meat and cheese plate (to die for) I think the fries were my fave...super golden and crunchy on the outside...thin but not shoe-string...and I don't even like fries that much.  So there you have it!
Great space.  Great beer.  Great food.  Bartender rarely smiled... maybe had a rough morning.  Sat at the bar for quick service, didn't get it.  Will give it a 2nd try though.
16 bucks for a 99 cent pizza :(.   Way over priced. We would not go back. Service was very slow and food was over priced. We did like the wings. The pizza was horrible and way over priced.

Fellow elite Lorraine F. and I were in search of bar to watch game 2 of the Stanley Cup finals. She suggested this place and I willingly agreed since I live in the area. Since it was a Wednesday, they have a special for their burgers and beers. I decided to order the hangover burger which comes with an over easy egg. I was pleased with my selection because the burger had quality ingredients such as a pretzel bun. "The bite" for this burger was rather large but I was able to make it happen, lol. I absolutely love their fries because they remind me of pommees frites. I loved them so much I almost wanted to ask for another order, but stopped myself because I was extremely full. Overall, this is a good place to hang out or watch sports. I will definitely be back and check out the outside patio area since it over looks Camelback Mtn.

Nice local pub. Good draft beer selection. Friendly and comfortable atmosphere. Met some very friendly regulars at the bar. The "Ivan Burger" is is a very good burger. I think its a great happy hour bar. Variety of weekly specials.
Some of the best burgers on the planet, great views of Camelback Mountain, friendly service, and sold out with a waiting list craft beer eventsffrom only the best breweries on the planet.
The Homburger is freaking amazing! Perfect mix of spicy & sweet. Also they have awesome assortment of beer on tap.

Pass by all the time but first time going in. Glad I did. Wait staff was super friendly and welcoming. Didn't catch their names but the brunette server and server with black hair were super nice and fun to talk to. Had the chicken sliders, which were amazing. Then had the best most delicious cheesecake I've ever had. Definitely would go here again and suggest it to others.

Visited the Attic because of the reviews I read on Yelp. I was visiting from LA for spring training and found this bar. We tried there famous pretzel hamburger and it was just like the reviews said, it was amazing.

The beer selection was great and the staff was very friendly, she recommended a beer that tasted like pumpkin pie... It did and was also amazing.. This will be a place that I will definitely be back.

If your a craft beer lover like myself, then your missing out if you have not given this place a go! You can also ask for suggested pairing with their great food menu offering something different each week. The staff and gm are also very knowledgeable about the food/beer menu.. Try to catch a sunset with their perfect view of camelback mountain patio seating.

Stopped by The Attic for KBS Burger night, the sequel, last night.
Best burger I've had in Phoenix! And the KBS didn't hurt either!
Keep up the good work!

What's the best reward after a tough Sunday hike? Obviously a burger and beer. 

   When we tried to find The Attic, we were lost. Four businesses....no "The Attic"....until we realized, the name was not just cute and memorable---it's the location. Going through the iron gates, we climbed the stairs and found this cool spot. It's not very big and that patio isn't being used due to work being done outside, but this place was full. 

     They offered a limited Sunday menu that boasted chicken wings and salads but most of all...The Ivan Burger. A massive amount of meat cooked to perfection, topped with the works (you can add Bacon and mushrooms as well) along with a chipotle mayo that got my tastebuds a goin'. If that doesn't make your mouth water the pretzel bun will. This burger is straightforward and a hunk of heaven. 

       Naturally I can't eat a burger without a brew to wash it down with. The Epic Sour Apple beer I picked was great. It had tangy, sour hints while not tasting too sweet like a cider. It was so good that the guy I was with liked it more than his more "manly" beer. I hold the title for fruit beer success. 

     All in all, I want to get back up to the Attic to see what they have in store on their regular menu, what a good hide away!!

In some of my favorite shows of all time where there is a group of close friends who always have their go to spot to hang out, drink, and eat.  Although, I just went here for dinner with my boyfriend, that's the vibe I go from this place: somewhere friends and families can come together to relax and enjoy a meal and drinks. While being here I saw a variety of "customer types". There was a few guys on the outside patio watching a golf game and drinking some beers, there was a group of friends having dinner and drinks, and there was a family also having dinner. I really wish I would've tried a burger because I feel like that's what they're known for, but we got the Two Brothers pizza and the traditional buffalo wings. Neither of these disappointed. I don't know how to word this other than the pizza had the perfect thickness. It wasn't overly doughy to the point where all you taste is bread and it wasn't too than to the point the bread is brittle and breaks off easily before you bite into it. The wings were just for my boyfriend and he liked them. I'm the foodie in the relationship and he rarely has a significant opinion about restaurants, but at the end of our dinner he said "I'd be open to coming back to this place."


We live right down the street and plan on coming back for random weekday date nights.

Very cool place. I've driven by this place many times and have also eaten at place next door, (Yacht House), finally a friend brought me here for their "burger weds" and man was I happy he did. 

So every Weds on top of their already amazing burgers they offer a special which is usually the one i'd suggest to get. Explosion of unique flavors such as Sriracha candied pancetta and something they call "food crack sauce" I've only been here twice and will most def be back. 

P.S. they have burgers available any night and many beer pairing to go along with the already good food.

I came to AZ for the weekend and wanted to try a brewery. Parking was kind of small and tight if you had a big car ( had a Range Rover ) . After we seated ourselves , it took forever just for someone to greet us and bring a menu .. other than that after  we received a menu and service, we ordered our drinks & food. Ordered 3 of the burgers on the menu , wings & meat platter .... amazinggggg!!!!!! I'll definitely be back when I'm in town .

Good Burger, Better Vibe and Amazing Service! Wife and I stopped here to try out their burgers we had heard so much about and loved it. The waiter was extremely pleasant! Would highly recommend to anyone!

The Attic has great burgers.  It's a nice friendly place with a view that you can order a glass of wine or a beer and chat with friends.  Great patio.  The service can be hit-or-miss that's why the 3 stars, otherwise it would have been better.  Prices are reasonable, food and variety is good, lots of beers on tap.  We'll be back.
The Attic is a great spot for a rare brew and a delicious burger. My fiance and I had a few of our first dates here, and later on we even said our first "I love you" in the parking lot! :)
The beer selection is great, and I usually just go for the beer.. On Wednesdays the burger and beer for 10$ is awesome but the veggie sandwich is kinda  veggie patties would be great!

I went here to meet some friends for Happy Hour and for their Wed burger deal. This place is awesome. The burger was talked up by my friend and I have some pretty high burger standards so the expectations were up there. It is easily one of the best burgers I've ever had. The fries were great as well. Just a great meal all around.

I only had one but it was a delicious Belgian that paired great w the burger. Was unfiltered but really smooth and pretty potent. The ambiance and service is very good. Would like to hang out on the patio next time and sit by the fireplace. I plan on coming back and introducing it to some friends.

As a bonus - it's right above my favorite deli spot Sacks.

We found this place on TapHunter a wonderful app for beer lovers. A great find! It was the day after Celebrate Belgium Independence Day and they were featuring Belgium beers on tap. Totally awesome. They apparently change featured beers  regularly so each trip should be a fun experience. We were also lucky to hit happy hour. $1.50 off on beer and very reasonably priced appetizers. Where can you find 3 types of chicken wings each  less than $5.  Plus you get a great view of nearby Camelback Mountain. Put this place on your wish list. You won't be disappointed.

Just stopped in after a long time of neglecting this place for years and always have had a good time here.  The bartender who was also our server was freaking PHENOMENAL!  The staff all around were great though.  She was helpful with her favorite picks and guiding our indecisive nature to a brew that would be in the neck of the woods of our palate.  The attic is definitely known for their burgers but we tried the Pizza since we were .  Sausage and Mushroom was the choice and it was pretty decent.  Thin crust that was a little flimsy but the dough was tasty, toppings good and cheese plenty.  I'm holding back that star for maybe a crispier crust next time.  If you're looking for a patio when the weather is better their patio is a great look at Camelback and for the sports goer they have plenty of TVs to keep your conversations minimal and your cheering at a maximum!

Hidden GEM! My brother was visiting town so we decided to hunt this place down and have dinner. I would totally recommend this place to anyone looking for a great burger!! melt in your mouth delish!! Its a cool spot  that is kinda hidden but worth the trip to Arcadia!

So! Happy! We! Found! This! Place! 

First off, from the moment we walked into The Attic from our yelp event close by the staff was so awesome! They seated us outside on the patio which was beautiful! It wasn't crowded at all, and the noise level was perfect! 

We ordered wine, and several different appetizers! Let me start with, they were delicious!!! We had wings, a pretzel, bruschetta, and caprese! My favorite was definitely bruschetta (but if you were to ask my stomach it would argue that the wings were favorite), the flavor of the Brie was so good! I found one of my new favorite happy hour places! 

I also saw in the menu that they are known for their burgers," I WILL BE BACK "(say it like you're Arnold in the terminator)! Hehehe. 

Honestly, what made this experience for me was not only how awesome the atmosphere and food were but how fabulous the staff was! They spoke with you on a personal level, they even took Brittany C.'s and I yelp tags and wore them around the bar! Classic. Thanks for such a great ending to our girls night out!

Very cool place with great burgers and a big list of craft beer. Bartender, chef, and server were very nice. Very cool feel and look inside. I had the Super Bowl Special which was a burger with guacamole and tortilla strips, which I couldn't understand why it would work but it did.

Bar-hopping with friends, never a dull moment. Climbed the winding staircase to this treasure at the advice of a friend. restaurant is clean and wide open, patio overlooks Arcadia landscape and you're up high. Happy hour is indeed happy, $3 wings and many specials.

If you're a watery beer drinker, beware, this place serves craft brews and there are no baby beers on tap. We enjoyed several brews and perused the menu. The ambiance is, well, mixed. Some hipsters enjoying the days while right next to them were some more "picky" clientele. I won't say more. This is Arcadia, the locals are allowed in, pleasant or otherwise. 

We tried an order of wings in every flavor and their specialty of the day, an Italian sandwich featuring Salami, which was beyond our expectation. Hey, the bread was good. We like that. The Attic Wings were a not-too-sweet soy/honey mix that really hit the spot. The buffalo style, well, pass on these, they seemed to be thickened with flour to the point of the sauce sitting on there 1/2 inch thick.  My veggie friend had huge hot pretzel and enjoyed that.

The chef came out and spoke with us and he seemed really interested in our experience. 

Off happy hour pricing looks high. But hey, that's what Happy Hour is for.

For having such great reviews, I was very unimpressed by this place. I'm not sure what  they are going for here, possibly a fancy higher-end drink and eatery thing. I was expecting a great beer selection, and on that front, they very much do have great craft beer. However, I've never seen anyone charge as much for beer as this place does. They jack the prices WAY up, so much so that even happy hour pricing doesn't really make it worth going. I ordered the happy hour tacos and they were good, but not amazing or anything. So if you have a lot of money to throw around for expensive beers and even more expensive food; well then you can do so with a nice view from the balcony.
I'm sorry but this pace is not good as far as the food - awful burgers!! Beer selection is good but that's it for this place! Will not be back.

This place used to be great. Burger special on Wednesdays is now not a special. Only certain types of beer and they raised the price. They also can't seem to cook a burger medium rare.  Last week I got a medium well twice. The new "manager" said it was because it had to come up the dumbwaiter from downstairs and it keeps cooking.  He also said I wouldn't have to pay for the replacement. How kind... I won't be back and we had been regulars for at least 4 years.

I'll have to give this place another try. We went on a busy Friday night and were seated at a table right by the entrance, kitchen, and drink station. Environment is one of the most important things to me in a restaurant and it was less than enjoyable. Our server was very attentive and I enjoyed the mead I ordered. My husband got a burger and I got fish tacos. The tacos were okay - fresh but not very flavorful. My husband loved his burger, it was nice and juicy. I think we missed out on ambiance of this place as I didn't even see what the whole restaurant and deck looked like because we were right next to the entrance. Honestly they shouldn't even have a table there as I don't know who would enjoy that spot.

Cute place with a good atmosphere. Not the best or worst burgers I've had,  but pretty good, and I did LOVE the fries that came with it! Although the meats on the meat platter appetizer were tasty, I was expecting a little bit more for $11. Most of the meats were very similar, and there were only two types of cheese, neither of which were that great. I would go back to get a drink and try a different appetizer....but wouldn't be my first choice for a burger. With that said, I did like the place, staff was friendly and food was good, just nothing special.

A friend told me I needed to come and check this place out as it was one of the best burgers she had ever had. She was not wrong! I ordered The Ivan with cheddar and bacon, and it was delicious! Not only was the food fantastic, they had a great selection of draughts, and the service was equally great. Our server was attentive and entertaining and overall made for a really enjoyable experience. We will definitely be back!

came here to get the Ivan burger and did just that.  It was pretty good but the pretzel bun overpowered it. i usually like pretzel buns though but it was good, when we go back ill try some other burgers. fries are great also and service.

I just got back from a small birthday celebration at The Attic, which was my first trip there, and one with high expectations. I am pleased to report my expectations were met, and exceeded, in every aspect from the diversity of craft beer on tap, to the quality of food, to the manner of service.

Cheryl was our waitress, and I couldn't be more happy with her service; she was friendly and responsive to our table of 8, including having amazing beer floats made for us, in order to celebrate my birthday, which were *not* menu items!

The Ivan was a fantastic burger: large, and delicious. If you are a fan of sours you may be interested to know they had both New Belgium's La Folie and Anderson Valley's Blood Orange Gose on tap, two of my favorites!

I'd strongly suggest going with one of the burgers, instead of the pizza. A couple of people in my party ordered pizza, which they said was average, while everyone else who ordered a burger thought it was way above average.

fanTASTIC cannot wait to go again. I totally forget what we ordered but here's my best guess:

-Bruschetta. Ridiculous. So good, had some kind of spicy chili oil.
-Some kind of grilled veggie sandwich, with grilled eggplant and we added chicken to it. I literally don't think I've ever had something so good.
-Hangover burger, with overeasy egg inside. GOD so good. 

Our waitress was frickin awesome and knew a ton about the menu and beer selection. Props, Attic, see you again soon.

The Attic is a pretty sweet spot to go to for wings, burgers and beers.  They have a nice sized menu of unique beers (that changes often), and overall the food quality is much better than your average sports bar. Specialty burgers, pizzas and appetizers....most everything is A+.  I personally love their dry rubbed Cajun wings with the chipotle dipping sauce.  It's de-lish!

The only reason this place doesn't get a 5-star rating is because the staff here rarely smiles.  And I mean RARELY!!  Sometimes they're friendly-ish, but most of the time they just seem sapped of any sort of enthusiasm, so service drags. If the staff was a little more energetic and on-point, it could definitely get the full 5 in my book.

Our first time at The Attic and we had high hopes. We sat outside on the balcony, which is just slightly awkward since you have to talk to your server over your shoulder. We ordered drinks and wings for an appetizer and didn't see our server again until our main food order came out. Our drinks sat empty until we had to ask the person that ran our food to find our server for us. Then once we received those drinks, we finished eating and drank the drinks. We had to ask two different people to send our server over with the bill. We had the Ivan burger and a mushroom and sausage pizza. Both were amazing which is why this place deserves the three stars. The lack of service really ruined the experience. We have decided that we'd go back because the food was so good, but we'll sit at the bar next time and not take our chances with the service.

This place is my jam! Their burgers are so delicious! Wednesday nights they have a burger/ beer deal. $5 off craft beer when you buy a burger. They have a wide variety of brews and change them out regularly. 

The Ivan burger and the holmburger are my favorites. But they also rotate specials and have some really creative burgers on that list. You can't go wrong with any burger here.
The patio has an amazing view. The food was superb, and Cheryl was the best server, ever.

I have frequent this place numerous times and have great experience,
but, this last Tuesday a slow night for them, it took 40 minutes to serve food, bacon limp and fries cold, which I always tell the server crispy bacon and well done fries. The server was nice but didn't take care of the few customers there. Also noticed on the bill we were told about the happy hour special but were not charged correctly.  Just a week ago I was there celebrating my daughter's bday, and it was perfect. I didn't see the owner or mgr there otherwise I would have mentioned it right there.

I am in freaking love with this place. Why didn't I ever come here before the name change? Yep that's right folks. That burger everyone loves so much was on the menu before the attic was the attic. 

Anywho... I came on a Wednesday and sat out on the patio in the beautiful weather Phoenix has a tendency to offer its residence this time of year. I peered over the selection of craft beers for something that shouted at me. Yes. A fine selection of funkwerks brews. I chose the deceit and the saison. And both would receive high markings from me on BA and untappd. I also ordered the Ivan burger and fries as part of the running Wednesday special. The fries were fresh and crispy and well seasoned. I love burgers. Love them almost as much as I love my first born. Especially gourmet, prepared medium, and housed by a pretzel bun. You need a good dense piece of bread to support the weight of such a delectable hunk of beef and apparently the attic knows what's up. This burger really is all the rave. Everyone should try it at least once. Peer pressure! 

I will most certainly be back. Most certainly for the beer and burger on Wednesday. Also don't forget that you're brews are $1.50 off for HH before 6 every weekday. If I wasn't saving myself for AYCE pad Thai I would be on my way there now!

This place is awesome. They have a great view of the mountains from the patio. Came here with my family and we shared different items. The dry rub wings, Louisiana wings (OMG good), pretzel with cheese sauce  (yum), the Ivan burger (super delicious) and the Sicilian combo pizza. Our waitress was great. Nothing better then enjoying good food with a beautiful view of camelback. Brother also ordered the wren sour beer, he enjoyed it. Definitely will come back. I have been here one time before and had the tacos which were amazing. You can not go wrong with their food, however, their menu is limited.

Oh wow, now I remember.
This is the place I went after getting thrown out of the Little Woody (across the street), only it went by another name at that time. 

I had several craft brews, got a spectacular view of Camelback Mountain at sunset, and got to eat someone's leftover half-burger. 
No I'm not homeless. What the fuck?

It's just that this old dude ordered a burger split. When it arrived, the chick he was scamming on was all...

    "Who's that for? I don't eat read meat! Do I look like I eat red meat?"

Yeah, yeah, yeah. Sit down and shut the fuck up I'm thinking to myself as this haughty little ingenue delivered a scene reminiscent of Scarlet 'fucking' O'hara in Gone With The WInd, her every word punctuated and overacted.

After her performance, she hastily stormed out. That's when I nudged the guy and asked if he was gonna eat that.

Anyways, I got a great craft buzz, ate a good half burger, and made it down the staircase without getting all knotted-up. 

All things considered, this was a five star in my book.
This place has one of the best buyers I've Ever tasted! So juicy and nice portion. Not only was the burger awesome but the pretzel was spool good too! The view is awesome as well.

This place is kind of weird...not in a bad way, but read on. So this used to be Cave and Ives which was I think more Mediterranean and a little classier - we liked it as. The new place is definitely a pub like experience mostly because of the menu.

They added a ton of TV's which was kind of fun, but the vibe still points towards a classier joint. They still have a great beer and wine selection and the decor is awesome...but again, and maybe I'm confused...its a pub! 

We ordered wings and the cheese plate to start. The wings were fantastic, so was the cheese plate but here is what makes me laugh, the cheese plate looks like it was plated by a pub but tastes like it belongs in a wine bar. It was cubed artesian cheeses that were all delicious, with great sides of nuts, fruits, olives etc.

I ordered the Margarita pizza and boyfriend had the breakfast burger, which was HUGE but good. 

I think I am just confused on what direction this place is going towards, menus and beers say pub, wine, cheese and decor say more of a wine bar with a little sass.

Needless to say, for the wings and beer alone, we will go back.

Great place for a burger and a beer! I was visiting from out of town & my (local) friend said it was a must try!

I have a burger and fries. Nothing to complain about!

My first visit here - tried fish taco, the hangover burger, and today's special fried oyster. The oysters were small compared to what I'm used to but I'm in AZ. What can I expect? Fried properly - ate with the house tartar sauce and it was good. Posted pix for other items and my comment, so check them out. Waitress/bartender was very sweet. So I'm giving 5 star rating for casual dining experience.

AMAZING! The quality of food and service is beyond what you expect from an ale house! Great beer and beer knowledge, great ownership and also very friendly employees. We got to talk to Carey the owner and his employee Tiffany and it was fun to chat about the business and what the company is about. I recommend you to come here if your local or even visiting!

5 stars ONLY for the food. Amazing burgers and bruschetta to die for. Service was very poor. Bartender/waitress was extremely unbecoming and acted very inconvenienced to serve us. Would go back purely for the food.

Great selection of craft beer on tap! Burgers are great! Wednesday night burger and brew for $10.00 can't be beat. When the patio is closed it's kinda tight and crowded, but the food is still good and the beer is cold!

This place has great food and I love Wednesdays here. They would get 4 stars except.... read on MacDuff... They offer a great, ever-changing, selection of microbrewery beers, ales porters and stouts from all over the US and Canada. On Wednesdays you can get their Ivan burger AND a pint of beer for $12. Now, for the bad news... Every, and I mean, EVERY time I've been here, either the service sucks, the server has attitude OR they somehow Fuck up something in the order. Sigh, but I return, always in hope....

This place is great! It's a good spot to watch a game, catch an afternoon break, or to spend a night. They have an awesome selection of beers / drinks to go with (what I would consider) very above average bar food. A sunny Phoenix afternoon  on the patio area, with the doors open is the best time to go!

My husband loves this place and I have to agree, their burgers are pretty damn good! 

I would appreciate a larger more diverse beer list, but for what it is, I will definitely go back!
Love their burgers! They also offer a gluten free bun and ciders for all you fellow people with gluten allergies
Great burgers and excellent beer selection with many screens to watch sports.  Parking is a bit of a pain

Beer selection is slightly better than Chili's. 
Bartender has personality of an empty keg. 
Bar had a good group of people with good chatter for you conversationalists. 
Food / Menu is small with just several burgers and some pizzas. It says they have an award winning burger but I did not try.   Although, when looking at the description, I am puzzled at how it has differentiated itself from others. 
I might try again but with so many good beer bars around it may be a while. 
Too bad as I was looking forward to this place.

Probably the best burger I've had in Arizona, hands down.

Great atmosphere, awesome beer list and a friendly staff willing to let you sample their beers before paying for a full pint. I will definitely be back and will probably become a regular.

My girlfriend and I went here last night to grab a drink together and it was a really cool place. They have about 20 different beers on tap and they were all different and very good! They give you samples if you want to try them. The burgers are great and the pretzels are good as well. The bartenders are nice and they also have a great outdoor area with a fireplace and heaters. I would definitely visit again!

Cold food and a cold shoulder. Customer service is better at McDonald's. 

I brought my food to the bartender because it was cold. No "sorry about that", nothing from my waitress, nothing from a manager, nothing from the guy that works here that was at the bar that let the bartender know I was there.  

Get your shit together.

If you want a place to come for good craft beer AND food.. this is where it's at. The burgers here are amazing! Best staff and really awesome atmosphere, and great local/mix craft beer selection, the handles around the bar create a really cool feel as well. Overlooking the greater Phoenix area with upstairs loft feel, on a cool evening with a sunset doesn't get much better!

Dont believe the hype.  This place is not that great.  Burger & Beer nite on Wed, is a good deal but not if you have to wait an hour to get seated.  Also, this place IS NOT kid friendly.  They dont have a kids menu if that tells you anything.  I told the sever we had 4 adults and 2 kids, she relys "I only have a 4 top if you want to be seated now".  Soooo, do I tell the kids to wait outside?
Great beer selection. Great food.  Cool patio to hang out on.  Make sure to always check what the daily food specials are...it's usually pretty creative.

Tonight is my first time eating here. The cheese & fruit plate was very good! Their cheese selection changes daily. The bread & cracker that came on it was delicious. I ordered the Ivan burger. We waited a good 40 minutes to get our food so that's why I'm giving a 4 star. It wasn't too busy for a Friday night. The burger was very delicious! But the patty wasn't hot, it was slightly warm so that was a minus but still very delicious. The side salad was so good! They make their own ranch, best ranch I've ever had. They have a special I guess Wednesday's Friday's and Saturdays but our waitress failed to tell us that before we ordered which I would have liked to know.. But very good. I will come back & try this place again!
Thank you Natalie! Great service, great food, wine and beer. You were very helpful with everything. Loved the Pinot, great appetizer and salads - just perfect.

For a Tap House, both Angel's Trumpet and Ground Control are better. 

First impression of The Attic was the annoyance over having to just find the place.They didn't have a clear sign on the road. Second was the required valet parking. I don't care if it's "free" (let's be real, you still need to tip the guys), but showing up at a tap house, you're not exactly expecting to hand your car over to someone.

When we got upstairs, they had a clearly marked sign that said SEAT YOURSELF, so we thought, "okay," and started wandering around for a place to sit, squeezing ourselves all the way to the back and then circling around. No seats. Got back up to the front and asked one of the servers, who looked at us like we were stupid and said, "you need to be put on the list." Okay. Take down your sign guys, why would you have that posted? So we sat in a small section off to the side waiting and proceeded to watch several other groups come in and do the same thing we did. Unfortunately, we couldn't warn them without jumping up and catching them as it is incredibly noisy on the inside and they wouldn't have heard us from where we were.

Food was alright, but not remarkable. Certainly not worth the hassle. And the beer was good, but it's not exactly hard to come across good craft beer in the valley these days.

It would have to be someone's birthday, or they'd have to have some damn, good special tapping for me to go back.

My party of four rolled in and up, but then one member had to take a call. The staff was very accommodating, as we ordered drinks and the food. Super nice waiter even offered to box the food for our fourth member when we ordered. 

Near the fireplace outside would have been a great place to have dinner except the weather was just a little too cold for me. There was a large party out there enjoying themselves though. 

I ordered The Ivan, hold the cheese, please. According to the menu, it is one of the top 5 burgers in the world, and I don't disagree (although I haven't had all the burgers in the world, yet). I made a New Year's resolution not to eat another pretzel bun, but since it was still 2015, I figured why not. Add avocado too, and bring it on with fries. I'll start that healthy eating in 2016. I wanted the full meal deal and paired it with a cider. Glad I did!

Solid selection of craft beers updated daily (use TapHunter to be informed of the list) and simple but amazing comfort food.
