The burgers live up to the hype, the Attic wings (grilled) become a craving after having once, service is on point and overall the staff is great considering how busy they are on some days.

If you had a bad experience here, it's likely that you are a bad person.
The food is fantastic and will not disappoint. The wait can be a little long, however with the food being prepared from start to finish it is well worth it. Always a great selection of beers on tap!

The location and patio are AMAZING. Everything else is awful. The beer list changes frequently but it goes from bad beers to bad beers. The food is ok at best and service leaves much to be desired there are a few awesome waitresses but if you aren't in their section be prepared to wait 15 minutes minimum with empty glasses. Forget trying to pay you have to flag down a different waiter or bartender to get your check. We keep trying this place I really don't know why though.

How much do I love this joint? Enough to get epically burger/beer wasted on a Tuesday and suffer the consequences ALLLLLL day Wednesday! The food is great, and the beer selection is awesome... Don't fall in love with a particular brew though- if you go back the next week, they've probably already rotated it out. Sucks monkey balls, but variety is the spice of life, right? Riiiiight!!! Go on a Weds-they have a special where you can get a burger, side, and a pint for $12! We're talking a MASSIVE burger too- no half ass skinny girl burger. Also- the ambiance is adorable- overlooking some mountain (IDK which one; there's like, a thousand in AZ) and the music is interesting/ varied enough that everyone will be happy. Impress your date, or hang with your buds-  a good time will be had by all

(Lyrics - Maroon 5 - Payphone)

I'm at the Attic trying a burger
All of my taste I spent on you
Where have the times gone? Bo Bites, it's all good
Let's go and make a reservation for two

Yeah, I, I know it's hard to remember
The reviews we used to make
It's even harder to take a pic
That you're here eating next to me

The Attic is located upstairs in ... well the attic - wink.  Actually its just plain upstairs if you want me true opinion.  Came in on a Wednesday happy hour and apparently it's $10 burger and beer night!  Super awesome in my books.  

They serve mostly craft brews so I went with the Avery Karma, a pale ale from Boulder, CO.  The ale had a crisp hoppy taste.  For the burger I went with their special, a mushroom and swiss cheese burger.  Overall, it was okay since I didn't really care for mushrooms in general.  The burger was not as juicy as I would like it to be even though I ordered it medium.  The bun was probably my favorite part.  Nice and toasty, but soft in the inside.  

Service was okay, except I would appreciate more smile I guess.  In the end, I think I would definitely return to the attic for it's atmosphere.  It had a sports bar lounge ambiance with a classic view. - Enjoy!

Burger + beer + game night?! Theeeee best combo to be at The Attic. Came here with a friend to watch Game 2 of the Stanley Cup championship and chose this place out of pure convenience for the both of us since it was the closest from our locations. It was a Wednesday, and they had a special - get any burger & a draft and get $5 off. For my burger, I got one of the veggie burgers since I'm not a big red meat eater & I didn't see any white meat burgers on the menu. The fries were yummy but the burger was honestly overwhelmingly healthy and are for true vegetarians (not me). 

The atmosphere here was awesome. There were TVs by the bar, outside by the patio, and all around the seating areas inside. It was easy to find a seat/table and watch the game comfortably. It was too warm to be out in the patio but I'd definitely consider sitting outside next time. Overall, this is a super solid place if you wanna watch any game and be comfortable.

The Attic is a great Arcadia gastropub; they have solid drinks, good food, and the upstairs outdoor patio view of the mountain cannot be beat. 

Parking can be a challenge, but once you've snagged a spot head upstairs to check this place out. The service isn't exactly overly friendly or attentive, but the wait is worth it. Take a seat, figure out what kind of drink you want (they have plenty to choose from), and check out the menu. I highly recommend a burger medium rare on a pretzel bun...holy smokes it is delicious! The fries are top notch as well. Some other good options that I have found yummy are the caesar salad, pretzel app with cheese sauce, and the pizza. My only knock on the food is that if you do not order your burger medium rare or rare they tend to come out like hockey pucks, and no one wants one of those burgers. 

The Attic is a fantastic place to grab some food, drinks, chill and watch a game. The view is spectacular and the environment is relaxing and pleasant. Don't expect to be in and out quick cause the service isn't swift, but like I said before it is worth the wait.
Awesome beer list. Top notch service! Friendly environment - check this place out ! We loved it. Veggie friendly :)

I was impressed with this establishment.  It is located above a sandwich shop in Phoenix.  They had about 20 different craft brews on tap as well.  I ordered the Ivan Burger with bacon cooked medium well.  The burger was very tasty and cooked perfectly.  The burger does not come with pickles so make sure you ask for them.  The burger is also served on a pretzel bun which was actually really good.  The fries were decent but you don't get many of them.  The burger and fries were about $12 ($1 more for bacon) and a craft brew will run you about $6.  The bacon was a little too done for my liking but that was the only flaw.

I recommend going during Happy Hour from 3pm-6pm because you can get $2 off an appetizer and $1.50 off of a draft.

Finally, the best day to go is on Wednesday because they have the Ivan Burger, fries, and a craft brew all  for $10 total.  That is almost 50 percent off the regular price.

Check out this place for a great burger!  It's one of the best places in the Valley for a burger and a brew!

Very nice outdoor area, dog friendly, good selection of beer and wine, good food and friendly staff. 
Had dinner here multiple times, haven't been disappointed so far. 
The fish tacos are good, and so were the bruschetta and the caprese salad. 
Lots of TV on for sports, it can get really loud but just being able to sit on the outdoor patio makes it ok.
Will be back there again soon!
The pizza is amazing :) I had the sausage and mushroom . Loved it . My only complaint was that the server up charged me with out asking .
Best Burger and beer selection in town! Friendly staff! Great place to see the locals and to hang out with friends!
I like this place to try new beers or have my favorite glass of wine/beer. The lobster roll was good and just the right size. Service was good but had to flag server down multiple times.

The burgers are tasty, but nothing better than what you can find at Red Robin. Nice atmosphere and patio. I'll be honest though, the biggest reason this place deserves 2 stars is the customer service. They poured us a flat beer, we immediately returned it, and they tried charging us full price for it. We only got half the beer price taken off after asking...

I love the attic bar, they have a fantastic ever-changing beer selection, served by extremely friendly and knowledgeable staff. Many times you will go to a bar and get very mediocre food, not here. The hamburgers are to die for, and they do have a Wednesday night burger special. The appetizers are also very good. The cheese and charcuterie is one of my favorites. They also have thin crust pizza that I enjoy

My neighbor told us about the $10 Wednesday special. Before going, we verified if this was true on yelp. The reviews were helpful but we didn't know that we can't share the special. I ordered the Ivan Burger and a craft beer for $12 and my partner only ordered the beer I had. The portion was big but the burger was bland so I boxed my half burger and salad. The cost for my burger and beer was $12 but my partner beer was $7.50.  Again, he had the same beer I did...that's way overpriced. Can't say we will be back any time soon.

Came here with great anticipation after having been once before.  4 of us ordered The Ivan (3 medium 1 well done) billed as being one of the "top 5 burgers in the world".  Unfortunately the 3 medium burgers were charred to the point of bitterness on the outside, even if the middle was pink (as ordered).  We were starving and ate them but it was not an enjoyable experience.   Am giving them 2 stars only because of good beer selection and because I had a good burger in the past.  If this burger was my benchmark I would never come back and tell people to stay away.  Mentioned it to the waitress and she said they may have turned up the heat because it was a "busy night" ??!??

Our server Cheryl was so attentive and sweet. I live around the corner and this was my first time in. I loved everything about my experience here. Had the Red Goat Pizza, WOW!!! And the patio was just lovely. Looking forward to coming back and defiantly requesting Cheryl for superb service.

Located upstairs this restaurant bar is a neighborhood gem.  Burgers are awesome and beer selection( craft beer) the charts!  Service is fast and friendly.  If you are looking for great local spot for food and drink come check the Attic out!

I used to frequent this place quite often with over 100 check-ins on Untappd just from stopping by over the course of a year for a beer or two after work or just a place to have a good burger (highly recommend the Holmburger!) and catch up with friends. The beer selection is great and usually changes often which is very welcomed! 

Unfortunately the past few times I've been there the service has really dropped down where I am barely being waited on and servers only stop by to take orders or drop off food. Last time I only had one beer, not because I only wanted one, but the server never stopped by even though we had  empty beer glasses on the table. It wasn't even a busy night...

The worst part now is that even though they have a great beer selection with many uncommon beers, you are now CHARGED FOR A SMALL SAMPLE! I sometimes like to try a small taste before I commit to a large glass, now I'm charged for both! When you have 30+ beers, it's nice to sample one or two first before deciding on one... Horrible policy which is driving away myself and others I have talked to there. We had a good run over the past year, sadly I won't be back...
Great beer selection, amazing rooftop patio, and awesome burger deal special on Wednesdays! My fiancé and I check this place out weekly! Highly recommend the fish tacos as well!!

I am a participant in a "Burger Club" and once a month a group of us goes to different burger spots in search of the valley's best burger.  I had missed the night that the group went to the reigning king, Relish. 

Well I can say there is a new King.  The Attic. Among 8 guys, I think 6 of us agreed this was the best burger we have discovered so far. I have since been back 3 times with people who are not part of our group but who also love a good burger (well, who doesn't) and so far, everyone has loved it.  

Didn't think I would care for the pretzel bun, but it's the perfect foil for the perfectly cooked egg atop The Hangover. 

Only criticism I would have is that my burgers tend to get slightly over cooked here. But still delicious.
Great staff. Friendly and accommodating. Excellent rotating craft beer taps and the Ivan burger is the real deal.

Half price wine on Tuesdays. What?!?! Had already eaten before coming but ordered a caprese salad...amazing! Tomatoes were form, bread was crispy yet soft, and they used very tasty vinegar and oil. Waitress was also very charming! Definitely recommend this place.
My favorite spot on Wednesday. $10 burger deal cannot be beat. Great rotating craft selection.

Tried this place out for the first time last night as my fiancé and I are brand new to town and wanting to try out nearby restaurants. Our pizza (the pepperoni) was decent, they have a great beer selection and offer some wine specials through the week. Tacos offered for taco Tuesday were also pretty tasty. Service was good..We will definitely be back!

A great beer selection is pretty much all it takes to make this girl happy. This place fits the bill! A cute little spot with great beers on tap, good service. Had a yummy sour from Destihl and a $7 Mikkeller beer flight (which I thought was a great deal since their beers are so pricey). Didn't try any food, but the menu looked good. I will be back!

Loved this place! My friend from out-of-town was looking for a good beer place to go to before I took her to the airport. She found this and we gave it a shot. Loved it!! We had views of Camelback Mountain, excellent food, and good drinks. I enjoyed the Ivan burger, which was amazing, especially with their special sauce to dip it in. My friend had the black bean burger, which she thoroughly enjoyed. We both enjoyed drinks, me with the mead. It was amazing! I would definitely go back to this place with friends as we all thoroughly enjoyed it!
Always love The Attic! Super nice staff and consistently good food. Usually always get the wings, also great pizzas and of course burgers. Ambience with views of Camelback Mtn are awesome!

Food was good. My party split the Ivan burger (5 stars) and the Goat cheese pizza. Enjoyed the meat platter app. However, service left a lot to be desired. This restaurant only offers beer and wine. Enjoyed eating outside on the deck.
Just maybe the best burger I've had in decades, plus a really interesting app menu and a great beer list.  All in a really nice space.

Great ideas, poor executions. 

In an area already over-saturated with burgers, the Attic is here to throw its hat into the already crowded burger game.  

The location is nice & cozy with a bar that feels like it's always happy hour. There's a decent variety of burgers on the menu, the pizza on the menu seems like a boring after thought, and their selection of appetizers is seriously lacking. 

I was really in the mood for a beer, but their beers we're primarily the heaviest, most high alcohol choices possible. I'm all about a nice craft brew, but most times I got stuff to do after I drink a couple pints. I dont want to be feeling like a comatose glutton after my food & drink. There needs to be some variety in their beer menu. 

The burger i got here was average, I didnt end up getting a beer since I wasnt in a mood for a heavy 8% abv brew, and the service was forgettable. 

So, with much better beer lists, pizza, & burgers in town, I dont see myself returning here anytime soon.

I heard a lot about this place. My clients talk about it all the time. So my girlfriend and I decided to come here for dinner. This place is located up stairs and we dined outside.

I never had a pretzel bun vegetarian burger before.. well.. ladies and gents. This is the place. It was so good. Get a salad though as a side, the fries were so soft and cold. I expect it to be hot and crispy. Nope. Our waitress was so slow! I think we saw her twice the whole entire night that we were.. if I needed anything. I had to get up and get it myself. It was pretty bad..

When we asked for the check. That's when she started to interact with us... yeah..... she was trying too hard.

This place is great, laid back and enjoyable. I took my husband there for his birthday, the Ivan burger is to die for and they gave him a little birthday dissent as well. The waitress was very amiable, and they have a great selection of beers. One of our favorite spots.
IVAN BURGER: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b2_vbou3kxE

A couple of us were looking for a chill way to bring in the New Year.  One where we were not committed to buying a ticket for a lame table full of appetizers and the promise of cheap champagne at midnight.  We arrived here just after 6. The area around the bar was full, it was in the low 50s-mid 40s, so a little chilly to be on the patio even if there was a fire and a couple of heaters.  We chose a high-top next to the bar.  
This was perfect.  Very casual and relaxed environment. Good for a first date, a night out with friends or even dinner with the family.    They have a nice rotating selection of craft beers on tap and in the bottle.  Food wise they offered a daily special (Cioppino on the night we were there) and are known for their burgers.  We wanted a little something to wet the appetite so we ordered a few wings (Louisiana wings, a little salty even for my salty palate, like they reduced some Franks RedHot a little too much but still edible).  We also shared a pizza.  It was very good and agreed that we needed to come back to try the infamous burger and to enjoy a warm winter sunset on their patio.

One of the first bars/restaurants I've visited since moving to Arizona! The waitresses were super friendly (even recommended other local bars I may enjoy - thanks Ashley!). The traditional style wings were the best I've had in awhile, and their beer selection is incredible! I highly recommend this spot for date nights, small group dinners, etc.
First time visiting and wow! Great burgers! Max was a great server too. He was very knowledgeable about beers/ciders and helped us with our selections. We will be back!

I had the Holmburger. WOW. Just wow. The candied jalapeño and pancetta were absolutely delicious. This burger was sweet, spicy, tangy, and savory all at the same time! Even though I was stuffed, the pizza smelled so good that I wished I had room for one. I guess I'll just have to come back!

We came back to the Attic for their Wednesday $12 Ivan and a Beer special and left two very happy and full campers.

Great service, great beer selection (The Avery Tweak was amazeballs, 17.5% ABV and delish if you like darker coffee/espresso type flavors), and great burgers once again.  We both chose to upgrade our beers to a fancier variety for only $2 more than the $12 special but still made it out of there dinner for 2 for $30.

I actually sent my friends a picture of my burger to taunt them.  It worked. Now my friends don'y like me and want to come to The Attic.

As they state in their menu, I've definitely had one of the top 2 or 3 burgers in my lifetime here...and two of the top 3 or 4. Their service is great, fast, friendly and informative. It's in a unique location and is truly one of a kind.

Sweet heavenly awesomeness. I know I live close to some amazing places. But really, how did I NOT KNOW ABOUT THIS PLACE? 

[Sorry about the shouty caps. Had to be done.]

Burgers, Holy BeDazzled Wonders of Pretzel Master Pieces. I am in awe of you. 

WHY 
Wednesday night $10 Burger + Beer deal. My life has been empty before knowing about this sweet deal! You can select ANY divine beer off their selection to match their burger. 

But, before I move on to THE IVAN BURGER, let me cover why this neighborhood bar should be yours. (However, I don't want you to come here. Where would I sit? :)

I arrived early to meet friends for a Yelp UYE. (Thanks Jeff E.!) Thirty minutes to kill so I ambled over to the bar. (As a side note: They have an elevator! This is important should you not be frisky in your step. Or, perhaps, may have consumed too much during your time at the bar. Just an fyi. So, FYI!)

THE BAR
The staff was super nice and directed me to the bar area, as well as letting me know there was seating available in the outdoor patio area. The outdoor area looks lovely, with a charming fireplace and copious amounts of comfortable looking seating. 

I never made it that far. There were some regulars at the bar who stopped me and insisted on helping me up to a bar stool. Before you judge, yes, I'm that short.  Also, I'm using walking sticks. So they were just being super nice. Anyhoo. The next bit will make ANY gal happy: They have purse hooks. WOOT!

In what can only be described as a PRIMO seat I faced Camelback Mtn. Being early has perks. Holy smokes. Watching the sun set is amazing from the bar. The outside patio view is probably killer. 

The bar rocked as there were two super nice bartenders spinning their attention out. LOVE them. The regulars rave about the bartenders for a reason, the bartenders are really that great. So are the regulars! I was so surprised to see adult talk amongst "regulars". Usually people who spend too much time at a bar, well, scare me.

Not here! I can't wait to go back! These were articulate adults from the immediate neighborhood. A solid conversation crowd. (The guys were discussing the merits of the different beers. Nerds!) The clientele changed slightly I noticed as the night progressed. Younger, but well behaved. 

HAPPY HOUR
Wowza. 
$2 off Bottle Beer
$1.5 off Drafts
$2 off Appetizers
Until 6pm

Subscribe to their Facebook page for other delightful promotions. (I did after my visit. They've got a sense of humor too.)

BEER
They've got lots of it. Good stuff. Multiple types of porter. 'nuff said.

THE DINING AREA
No reservations, generally four tops which can be put together for larger groups. There's a long table in the back. (That's where we sat. It comfortably accommodates 6. We had about 8. All good.)

Mood lighting is conducive for intimate conversations.

THE BURGER DEAL - Mr. Ivan
This fella is huge. You can't split or share him with a friend. You should come hAngry. He's HUGE! Filling and well prepared with your choice of cheese. Tomatoes, onions and chipotle mayo never tasted so delish on a burger...until you tried it on a pretzel bun. Seriously, you've got to try.

I dinged the review a star for the fries. I'm sorry :( (They're stringy and were almost air dry. Like chips.)  

Bookmarked for regular visits. Loved it!

Stopped in here on a whim and was not disappointed!  Fantastic selection or rotating beers on tap, a lot of tvs with good sports on, and the Buffalo chicken wings had a great spice with a very good blue cheese.  I can't wait to come back and try more food and beer!

Where do I begin? Firstly, I was recommended this place by a friend who must not consider me a friend because they told me this place was phenomenal. They must have lied. I came with my boyfriend (whom is a kitchen manager at another similarly themed craft beer & burger restaurant) on a seemingly slow night. We were excited to try this spot! There were only 6 other tables at the time we arrived so we anticipated a fast & accurate experience. Well, it was anything BUT fast or accurate. It took over an hour for two burgers & fries, & when it did come out, it was the wrong order all together. There was not one thing that we ordered (other than fries) that actually came out to us. And the server provided no reconciliation for the wait time or the wrong food, she honestly tried to displace the blame on us for "asking so many questions about the menu" that we confused her. I'm sorry, it's our first visit!!! This place isn't welcoming AT ALL & the servers walk around like are completely annoyed 24/7. We didn't even eat our food, other than a few of the cold French fries that came out with our wrong burgers. This place may have had good food at one time, but now they are just arrogant & lazy about their product. Like other reviews say, the market is overly saturated with burger joints nowadays so I'll gladly take my time & money to an establishment that actually appreciates their patrons. This place is laughable.
I LOVE THIS PLACE. Amazing veggie burger, cool atmosphere. I would for sure come back to this place and have some beers next time.

I (finally) went to the Attic last night with the husband for their Wed night burger and beer special (10$ for both). I was surprised (and I guess I shouldn't have been) that they had valet... I have a huge pet peeve for valet, especially when I see that the car is just parked in a normal space...not double parked or whatever would necessitate valet... but I digress. We went up the stairs to find a chalkboard to put our name on the waitlist... cute idea. We waited a short amount of time and were seated. The place was very busy, but our service was fast, friendly, and efficient. The husband and I each got the Ivan with bacon, I got a side salad and he had fries. The burger was a very standard burger. It wasn't anything I was terribly excited about, but it was large and tasty enough for the price. I will say, I wouldn't want to pay full price for this particular burger, but the hangover burger sounded good. The salad was tasty and had a great balsamic vinaigrette. I would come back here for their specials again and would like to try their happy hour, but I am not sure that I would come here on a regular day (the hangover burger is 14$.... that's a bit steep).

I adore this place. It's quirky location, secret entrance, phenomenal views and superb beer selection. I love the decor, happy hour deals, the amazing service and one of the top 3 cheeseburgers I've ever had. I cannot wait to return and have told so many people about this place Ive lost track. It's on the smallish side so definitely not looking forward to winter crowds - I'll be back before the birds descend. Do yourself a favor and check this place out. And don't get a salad. This is the spot for cheat night. Best pretzel bun I've tasted on the Ivan. The bruschetta is also fantastic.
Think I'll be back sooner than expected...

I love the Attic even more now than I did when they first opened. I still enjoy the classics- the Ivan burger and their bruschetta as well as the revolving beer taps. These days, though, it is the Arcadia wings that win my heart and their big events like the crab and lobster boils.

I had been hearing about this place for a couple months now. I finally got the chance to go today and see what the buzz was about.

The menu isn't too large; it's comprised mainly of pizza and burgers, appetizers, and a few salads. I heard the burgers were good so I decided to go with The Holmberg - pepper jack, strips of fresh jalapeños (I love fresh jalapeños - nice touch), candied prosciutto,  sriracha, spring mix, onion, tomato,  topped off with "crack sauce" (still not exactly sure what it is), on a pretzel bun. Well...all I can say is amaaazing! Truly one of the best burgers I've ever had. I'm not sure if it was the candied bacon or the crack sauce or a combo of the two but it had this sweet syrupy taste to it which may sound weird but man does it work. It was so good. My compatriots who tried it agreed that it was delicious. My friend had the hangover burger and said it was pretty darn good. My other friend had what I believe was called the Sicilian pizza. I tried a sample and it was pretty good. 

I also had two, yes two, glasses of Moscato. Mmm a burger and Moscato...don't judge me it was a good combo! Pretty decent Moscato. My friend had a couple different IPA's...I think they have different ones every day or every week? I'm not a beer drinker so I can't remember what the waitress said. 

The only real complaint was the price...it's a tad pricey. I think both the burgers were $14. The pizza was $15, the Moscato was $8 a glass. That's pricey for burgers and in such a casual atmosphere but the burger is so good I'd come back and pay It again when I'm really craving a good burger, but It will keep me from going often. On Wednesdays though they have a pretty good special - The Ivan burger plus a beer for $10 if that's your thing (beer...Bleah lol). 

Overall, the food is great so I'd recommend this place and I will go back in the future.

If you love craft beer and amazing burgers, this is the spot for you. Probably the best deal in town is Wedsnesday nights- featuring your choice of the specialty burger of the day or the Ivan burger along with any craft brew on tap for only $10. Seriously, it's amazing, the burgers are just about perfect everytime. The pretzel bun is the ideal bun for the big juicy meaty goodness as well, and just might be the best part. Clearly I'm a fan. 
Also, there are great views of camelback and service has always been good as well. Get over there on a Wednesday, you'll be glad you did!

We went there on St Patty's Day. Our service was not so good odd cause it was not busy. Until the GM Jerry came over then our waiter seemed more interested in our service while he was at the table. I had a peanut butter nitro it was . They have a lot of choices though and so that means more options to explore. Our food was  we did not have the famous burger guess we should have.

What a great find! I have a friend who recommended this place and I wrote it down on my phone. I am glad I did. I just don't remember who recommended this place so I can say "Thank you!"
Amazing beer selection. Food was great, service was very friendly. I had a blueberry cider that was amazing. Burger was perfect, pizza was amazing. Highly recommend. Will definitely be going back.

While in Phoenix this weekend, my BF and I came here specifically for BURRRGERRRSSS.  We were drooling over the Ivan Burger on Yelp before we arrived to the desert. So when we finally got to dine here, it lived up to our food porn expectations. 

Started off with the Meat and Cheese Charcuterie plate to share. YUM.
We both got Ivan Burgers. Medium rare. Perfect. Delicious. YUM YUM. 
Nice selection of beers to pair with our meal. Mmm Mmm Mmm. 

If you love to eat, throw back a few beers, and you enjoy a laid back atmosphere, then add The Attic to your destinations list.

The Attic has 24 of the best craft beers you've never heard of.  I consider myself pretty knowledgeable about beer, but this place reminded me that there are so many good beers out there that I've never tried.  A must try for the craft beer lover.

Our server told us that the beer menu changes daily.  I believe it, because the paper beer menu on our table had a slightly different list of beers than the two dozen or so written on the chalkboard on the wall.

The Attic does a good job of describing its cornucopia of malty offerings - giving the origin of the beer, the bitterness units and the % alcohol.  There is an early afternoon happy hour that is great if you want to catch a football game on a Saturday or Sunday.  

Oh yeah, and the food was pretty good too.  I enjoyed the cheese platter, which had a good sampling of fruits, nuts and artisan cheeses.  The gorgonzola and apple salad was phenomenal and full of flavor.  I didn't have one of the cheeseburgers, but they looked pretty juicy.

Did I mention they have a rooftop patio?  The whole bar and restaurant is on the second floor.  Tha patio faces north, away from the sun, and was a pleasant place to sit on a nice fall day. 

The only complaint I had was the service.  It was friendly, but glacially slow.  It's fine if you plan to spend an afternoon meandering your way through the beer menu, but if you're hungry you might be annoyed by the long wait for your food.  To be fair, we were a large party, but on the other hand the bar wasn't THAT busy.  Overall, though, worth checking out!

We went there based on Yelp reviews and the beers they carry. WE ARE GOING BACK because of our kick ass waiter, I forgot his name :( and the AMAZING food! This place was great from the second we walked in. Its not too big to be annoying and not to small to be annoying. I loved it and even got a growler to go. Our waiter knew a lot about beer and was very helpful when talking about the menu and the different things The Attic does on different nights of the week. Its a bit of a drive for us but totally worth it.

This place has an awesome beer selection, great friendly service, and an interesting 2nd floor location. I got a hotdog I'll never forget and some sliders that were to slide for! The valet parking seems inappropriate and shouldn't exist, but you can always park across the street for free.

Burgers are delicious, albeit a little on the pricey side.  My favorites are the Hangover and, of course, the Ivan.  The wine options are all a little too expensive for what you get, but you're at an Ale House, so drink the ale!  They have a giant ever-changing selection of beer with excellent prices that includes something for everyone, even wine drinkers like myself.  Ask your waiter for a sample if you're having a difficult time deciding.  All in all, the Attic is a fun place for a night out with friends, especially if you come for Happy Hour.
The food and service here are amazing. My girlfriend and I had hoped for a full bar but the beer, wine, food and atmosphere were awesome. We will go back for sure.

Pretty great burger, but super salty french fries. For an Ale house, the server's knowledge and their policy on beers should be significantly better. 

I wanted to try the saison, but the server had never tasted it and knew nothing about it (She actually didn't even know what it was until I pointed to it on the menu). Upon asking for a taste, I was told that I could not have one because their tasters are all 2 ounces. I said that I did not need anywhere near that amount...just a small squirt in the bottom of the shot glass to get an idea of the flavor. Amongst other excuses about not allowing tastes to keep the prices down, I was told that they have "special" taps that can't pour under 2 ounces. That's when I called BS. No reputable ale house, brewery, or most bars for that matter, would trousers to provide a small taste and risk a customer not being satisfied with their order. So I told the server that I would simply order and then send it back if I didn't like it since they were giving me no other option and she knew absolutely nothing about it. When I received it, as soon as I touch my lips to it, I could tell it was pretty much a sour... Something I definitely wouldn't have wanted had I known. Anyone with any knowledge of their menu should have known something this obvious about the flavor profile. I sent it back, but was still charged. I would've argued to take it off, but my friend decided to pay for it rather than make it an issue. Too many other great places in town so no reason to return. Hash kitchen is opening next-door, I will definitely be going there for brunch next time instead... or to roaring fork if I want a burger.

My roommate and I were looking for a place to grab a drink with a nice patio, and I'm SO glad we decided to come here! It was exactly what we wanted and more. 

We got bar/patio seats on the top floor overlooking Indian school. Their beer happy hour selection and prices are really impressive and I wasn't able to try the food but it looked and smelled amazing - will definitely be back to try one of their burgers. 

The best part about the experience though was our server Kaylen, she was extremely friendly, personable, got our drinks out quickly, and was the exact right amount of attentive. Can't wait to go back to explore more of the menu!!

One of my favorite burgers in the valley and by "one of"I mean tied for favorite . The Grind is my other favorite spot but definitely more creative menu options and 20+ beers on tap here. The Attic is famous for the Ivan which is not bad at all after it got ranked top ten in the world by a legit burger afficionado guy. Yet my favorite is the Holmburger and it's Crack sauce. Yes Crack sauce is my favorite. All burgers are on a pretzel bundle which is made at the bakery downstairs (Sacks) Most burgers are $10-15 prepared to your level of pink and come with a choice of sides fries side salad and maybe something else? I usually get the wings as appetizers. The house wings crispy areare my favorite. Not a huge fan of the dry rub version(forget flavor name) Thursday tends to be a a featured burger day. They have appetizers and entrees that they rotate (listed on bottom of weekly beer list also weekend brunch stuff they rotate. There was an old manager named Ryan who really brought all this together and totally passionate about food and beer as well. He's no longer there but still plenty of quality staggy that have been there a while. Tiffany is one of the bartenders that is usually there always peppy friendly and honest. I've never had any service issues so don't that random article from a while back on azcentral 3tv or whatever keep you from checking out this spot.

First off, let me say that I am a young, 5'10" moderately fit male who CrossFits only 2-3 times per week and occasionally eats vegetarian. My friend brought me to the Ale House for a burger on a Thursday night after a dust storm. It was a late dinner, but don't get me wrong I am an early bird. Admittedly, I was not used to the pacific time zone. I do think coffee helps me to get going early in the mornings (both my brain and my colon), but no more than a half of a cup before my GERD really flares up. A doctor recommended Tums but then I sometimes get constipated which interrupts my early morning CrossFit schedule.
After climbing the stairs to the Attic Ale House we were caught off-guard by the HORROR that had unfolded in front of us. The front of the restaurant reminded me of a warzone left for us to piece together the backstory. It appeared a patron had emptied their stomach and guts in a projectile fashion onto the doorstep of the restaurant. I could only imagine that the restaurant cast a curse so damning that he or she was able to make it only to the doorstep of the restaurant before being condemned to the most gruesome thing I've seen since Saving Private Ryan. As we tippy-toed by in disbelief we hadn't processed what we had witnessed until we were inside the restaurant. Most people would have left right there. For whatever reason we were drawn in further, ravenous zombies determined to find food. Maybe our subconscious could foretell the meal that was coming our way. Maybe we were scarred from the sight and couldn't dare to pass by it again. We didn't turn back.
We wandered like shell-shocked soldiers to the bar and sat down. I ordered the Amber Ale and the HOLMBURGER with sriracha crack sauce. What I later devoured that night was the BEST BURGER I've had since my short time here on this planet. And I'm a cheating vegetarian mind you! The crack sauce lives up to the name, making this the best burger I can remember. HIGHLY RECOMMEND, 5/5! I rarely still lose sleep at night and wake up vividly remembering what I saw on doorstep, but would definitely go back when I am in town again The Holmburger with Crack Sauce was well worth the experience. Well done Ale House!

Every time I'm here, they run out of something! It's totally ok due to the fact that everything they DO have, is awesome. I ordered the Kolsch but got the Tombstone due to CO2 problems, loved it. No hummus? No problem....have the pretzel! There are literally 25 or so beers on tap so if they run out, the bartenders can always help you find something you like. Be aware that they charge you .50 for a taster which is a little cheesy, in my opinion.

'The Ivan', one of the best burgers in town. The bun is amazing & beer selection is impressive. Pkg a little tough but nobody home next door...Literally;) ps wings (santa fe), salads & sliders also to die 4!

Amazing burger!

We stopped in for the Wednesday night special (burger and draft for $10). The restaurant is open, with neat decor and a nice ambiance. Service was good, too. The burgers were perfectly cooked (we asked for medium). The veggies were fresh and crisp, and the pretzel bun, though a little salty, was a great accent. Fries were fresh and fried to perfection. Our server was super nice and let my glass of wine count as part of the Wednesday special.

I really want to try their other stuff, like the pizzas, but if nothing else, try the burger. So, so good!

If you enjoy being served wine out of a DIRTY A$$ wine glass, come to The Attic. 

There is noooo waaaay the waitress didn't notice how absolutely filthy my glass was when she served me. How dreadful & disgusting!

I won't lie- the pizza was delish but with one caveat: eat it all at the restaurant and don't take it home. The crust is weak and thin and even trying to reheat it the next day in the oven results in a limp pile of pizza-mush. Thumbs down.

Solid place to go on a Wednesday night in Phoenix. The burger special that night will keep you coming back. The people are friendly and the beer selection is great. Best of all they switch it up every week!

Let me start with my waiter James...AWESOME! He's everything you'd expect at a great establishment and more! He took excellent care of us, and took the time to check on & explain everything we ordered. The food...oh the food...simply perfect. I've heard about this place for some time, and I'm glad I finally came. Such an awesome deal on Wednesday burger night. A burger and a pint of beer for $12...you can't beat it. My picky ass wife even loved everything...including James! See you guys next week!

My son just turned 21.  We decided to go to Attic Ale House to eat dinner and celebrate.  Alex, our waiter, was superb. He made us feel at home and was there on point with our refills and a smile.  We tried the pizza, wings and the burgers.  On a scale of 1 to 10 .......Pizza was a 7.  Wings were a 9.  Burgers were a perfect 10..!!  But the entire experience was a 10.  I can't wait to go back.

Loved it! Just above my favorite sandwich place. My friend and I shared hot wings (happy hour) and IVAN burger with fries. So delicious! Great beers on draft too. Definitely coming back for more, looking forward to coming back on a Wednesday for their burger and a beer for $10 special.

Five starts hands down for the view. Amazing happy hour for the quality of the beer, I would pay more .. The burgers are huge and not Donald Trump huge - actually big. Small place so be patient when being seated. Would go again a million times..

There was a time I told everyone what a deal this place was on Wednesday. That is no longer true. They still have their Wednesday burger and beer special. But, what once was $10 for a delicious Ivan Burger and a craft beer is now $14 to $16 depending on the beer you order. They also used to have a weekly beer rep doing a mini sampling of a line of craft beers and handing out swag. The Wednesday I went, there was no rep to enhance the beer and burger experience. I also get the impression they cycle through waitstaff frequently. At least half the times I have been there the waitress has admitted it was her first week working there.

Call me old fashioned, but if I am paying $14 for a burger, I expect to be in a place with better than a basic sports bar atmosphere.

However, if you are a fan of burgers, they are still tasty. They pair well with their nice selection of craft beers on tap. Finally, their main drawing point and reason for their "Attic" name comes from being a rooftop bar with a of Camelback Mountain (if you overlook the busy Indian Bend Road below)

Good food, good beer. I've been here about 10 times and have always enjoyed myself.  Our last visit they charged for a tasting, which they've never done before and they didn't tell us there was a charge. Tonight my wife ordered a beer that was supposed to be an 8-oz poor and came back with a 5-ounces. When she asked them to fill it the rest of the way it still came back short of the 8 oz. I don't know what's happened the past couple times we've been here but a I'm a little bit disappointed.
Ummmm, yum, that is all. What a view of Camelback mountain. I loved this place. Great burgers and the wings are to die for. Happy Hour is a great deal!

One of the better burgers in town. The Pretzel bun is very tasty and holds up well . We shared the hangover hamburger and Sicilian pizza. I was expecting the Sicilian pizza to be a little bit more tasty. Hangover hamburger had bacon and eggs which earned the accolades from burger magazine as one if the best. The best surprise were the fries that come with the burger. They were prepared perfect, crispy but not over done.

The place is upstairs with a small parking area. If you are into beer, this is the place for you with a huge selection on tap.

The service was good and friendly. Could see this place as a great place to hang out to eat and drink

While my Burger was amazingly good.....I still didn't love this place at all.  The service and vibe of the staff is that of an old dive bar in Cave Creek; only they are young girls. Weird.  and the place isn't that appealing unless it is your neighborhood bar and its just a proximity thing.
